Introduction

Science Fiction and Fantasy are exhilarating expressions for both readers and writers alike. Writers reach to become futurologists as they practise forecasting trends or developments in science and technology, or the next phase for political or social structures.
Science has a long way to go as magic became a term used between people who wished to keep to tradition and those who strive to understand our limits and push them further. The development of secret science caused people to believe in magic. 
Another path for science to understand is spiritual frequencies. Frequencies are just a fraction of the unseen realities present in our day to day lives. As we isolate and understand the aspects of unseen realities, our perception of what science is will change and our minds will open wider to accompany a wider sense of thought and possibilities.
How will unseen realities affect our day to day lives? Be prepared for the old ways will pass away and our life styles will change. Things will not always seem to get better, but we have the potential to make our world a better place to live in.
Change usually starts with the planting of a few new ideas. A new idea is like a seed. If taken care of properly, it will grow. Ask anyone who has lived a long life and they will tell you there is something new to learn everyday so cut loose any arrogance you might have of closed in, narrow minded thought and let your imagination free. Liberate the world we live in as together we push the boundaries of limitations for truly the sky is the limit for all mankind.
I would like to see the category, Science Fiction, become known as Inspired Visionary Fables. Just as one story teller inspires another, so a true visionary can inspire the world we live in with the powerful seed of a fable.
I am blessed to have lived long enough to bring a story to fruition which has been a big part of my life for so long. What we think is not supposed to stay in our heads, it is to be shared with the rest of the world.
Thank you for letting me share Genation with you.

Robert A. Hunt

Prologue
It's Genation Time

Where does time and space start? And where will it end? Let me tell you how it works. Time and space is mathematical and separate. It is an all encompassing energy of existence in motion, from the alpha to the omega. Time and space started from one place, at one moment, and it is leaving a trail of history. The future is not set, it is what we make it and the same is true with the past. So we have time and space and how it is perceived by those caught up in it, who are the living.
Humans experience the passing of time as sometimes fast and sometimes slow depending on how involved they are with current activities. Some ancient Greek philosophers believed that time is an illusion and reality unchanging and motionless. Christianity teaches that time and space are created by God and everything is destined to end one day in terrifying devastation. Supposedly, fortune-tellers or psychics have the ability to see into acts of ones personal history or future. Isaac Newton believed in a time and space that were absolute, ideal, and unchanging. His version was overthrown by Albert Einsteins theories of relativity, which required people to think of a space-time combination in which all manner of strange things could happen that contradicted common sense.
Common sense tells us that time, unlike space, extends in only one direction: forward. Spontaneous events in nature, which tend to work in a chronological order, seem to prove this observation. Albert Einsteins special theory of relativity challenged all conventional ideas about time. Einsteins general theory of relativity predicted that clocks run slower in the presence of a gravitational field. This is called time dilation where a clock in space runs faster than an identical clock on Earth, where gravity is stronger. Both Einsteins predictions concerning time dilation have been experimentally confirmed. Today scientists no longer consider time as an independent, constant entity, but as one aspect of an interdependent space-time continuum. They know that the time measured by a clock depends on where the clock is and how fast it is moving in relation to the observer. Time is capable of fluctuating.
To date, humans have not found any success in manipulating time. Perhaps it is far too complex for our comprehension. Time is not only mathematical and intelligent, it is a living energy, mastered on what we would perceive as a spiritual level. Unbelievable? This concept is not for humans to understand, though we strive to nonetheless. 
Space, though deathly cold, is full of life. Our little planet is a significantly small part of a monumentally larger picture. Other intelligent creatures who share our space are still searching for answers to the same big questions we have. Though they are no closer in finding the answers, some of the creatures are leaps and bounds ahead of us.
Humans have become arrogant at the top of the food chain of this planet Earth. We have become blinded to how far we can still progress. If we were visited by another species, like Volks, we would see the disadvantage we would truly be at. To be discovered by such a species as Volks, who have mysteriously passed through space and time to reach us would start speculations of how the arrogant humans might soon find themselves slaves to a master alien race. This is our government's secret fear for it would mean relinquishing all authority. 
The Genation nebula, which is found at the center of all existence, is an accumulated energy with intelligence. We humans are born into a world of discoveries. It is only our arrogance which leads us to believe all we have seen and heard is all there is. As we search time and space we will find more questions than answers. Some of the discoveries from larger perspectives will provide answers to unsolved mysteries of our history.
Genation is not God, but the power within it is certainly God-like only because we lack the scientific knowledge behind it. The highly intelligent Morguldean space explorers have been studying Genation ever since they detected it. They are mostly focused on the aspect of time altering space. The reason the Morguldeans and Volks know Genation is the center of all creation is because everything in space is not only moving but it is all moving away from Genation. This makes Genation the center where a supreme intelligence may calculate a demonstration of creation through a cipher language using power over matter and anti-matter bound for a system of progression of first to last in a space-time combination throughout a Chronological time-line.

Prepare yourself to open your mind to a whole new world.
Prepare yourself for Genation.

Chapter 1

The depths of space was like a forever midnight, stretching out into a timeless eternity, never meeting with the break of day. 
Opening his eyes wearily, Eddy Evon recognized his surroundings. He was amidst the quiet buzzing cock-pit of his space craft, the Zandith Crockmior L/X. This space craft was a synthetic organism created from a technology far beyond human capability. Though Eddy Evon was not human, he no less felt very much alone. Still a little fuzzy about events before he blacked out, Eddy gave his head a shake and tried to connect the dots.
Grizz, where could he have gone? Eddy wondered, examining the interior of the tight confinements of the craft. The last thing Eddy could remember was nearing a strange alien space station with his co-pilot, Grizz, at his side. Eddy didnt expect to find any sign of life in the twin nebula of Genation before they entered it, but a swarm of living, glowing blue spheres moved from the nebula and showered the Zandith Crockmior L/X, before Eddy lost consciousness from a telepathic overload. 
Only a space craft equipped with the capability of generating enunamic reality fields would be able to travel the incredible distance past countless galaxies to the Genation nebula. To travel faster than multiple light years, and to protect the pilots from the immense force and energy required to make the distance in a short time, the Zandith Crockmior L/X had to have enunamic field technology.
With the appearance of a wasp insect, fifteen meters in length, the Zandith Crockmior was just one of countless designs to navigate remote areas of deep space. When traveling, the wings flapped in a blur of motion and lit up with a soft blue light of power. The energy from the wings charged the enunamic fields. 
Colored with deep yellow and black, the Zandith Crockmior's long thin legs remained folded up underneath. The wings established the enunamic reality field as the two pilots were situated on their fronts upon organic prop supports within the head or cock pit of the organic space craft.
Eddy was decorated in specialized army gear, custom designed for the form of a volk. He also wore grey and black camouflage pants and a black sleeveless bullet proof vest. Designed by humans for the feet of volks, Eddy also wore heavy military boots. Clasped to his left fore-arm was a dark metal device. The body of a volk was somewhat human-like in form, but not enough to pass as human, for they had grey skin with a tint of blue from head to toe. They had twin spines and flat bony rippling plates on their fore-arms and shoulders. On the average, a volk ranges between the heights of eight to ten feet tall and they are extraordinarily large due to their bone size and muscle capacity. This particular volk, Eddy, was average for a typical volks stature. Hair does not grow on the skin of volks and their eyes are black, blacker than space beyond Genation. With small pointed ears and powerful chiseled features, Eddy felt a deep warning cast over him like a shadow of evil next to the light of pure bliss. The shadow of evil was felt on a telepathic level for the red swirl of the Genation nebula and the light of pure bliss was felt for the opposite twin blue swirl.
The side of Eddys face hurt as he realized since Grizz had left, the blue spheres were no longer a threat. Did the blue spheres take Grizz somehow? 
With his black knights helmet removed Grizzs matted dark hair grew in over the outskirts of his face with sweat sticking strands to his skin. Grizzs skin was mostly human, though a few portions of the grey volk skin had been graphted in amongst the human skin. Scars lined Grizzs face like a road map. Thick eye brows grew from his muscled brow and stubble discolored Grizzs chin and jaw. Though a strength and deep anger and pain were detected in the eyes of Grizz, so also was a sense of how, mentally, he would always be more human-like than volk.
Evon. Eddy called out before a miniature flying robot emerged quickly from his ear and circled about in a wide arc before slowing to a stop, facing Eddy.
MY LORD, YOU WENT UNCONSCIOUS BY THE WILL OF THE INTELLIGENT BLUE ENERGY BEINGS. The robot explained with reference to the glowing blue spheres. WE WERE LURED INTO THE ALIEN SPACE STATION AND GRIZZ TRIED TO AWAKEN YOU.
Eddy gently placed his hand on his tender and swollen cheek. Why did Grizz leave the Zandith Crockmior? Eddys voice was deep and forthright as he peered out through the view shield. The craft was indeed within a cargo hold of the alien space station. 
The compartment outside was taller than it was wide in an octagonal shape. The metal material of the walls was of a strange shimmering energy. Attached to the walls was a number of heavy duty, semi robotic arms. A couple of the arms were stretched out and holding the Zandith Crockmior securely in place.
GRIZZ WAS LURED OUT OF THE ZANDITH CROCKMIOR AS THE ALIENS HERE USED A SOPHISTICATED TELEPATHIC SUGGESTION TO CONVINCE HIM TO DO SO. The little robotic sertz was as helpful as it could be, but Eddy considered whether or not to go after Grizz. He had already risked so much to get to where he was and Grizz may very well be compromising Eddys goal to return home to the planet Verticus. Unable to forget how Grizz was like a brother to him, Eddy knew going home alone was not an option.
Deciding to leave the Zandith Crockmior, Eddy slipped out through the mouth of the Zandith Crockmior to the weightlessness of the space station. Smelling the surprisingly well filtered air, Eddy examined the interior of the cargo hold. As he looked around he noticed something metal which he instantly recognized.
Under the wasp-like space craft, Zandith Crockmior, Eddy found his old trusty double bladed axe still clutched in the claws of the Zandith Crockmior. Taking the axe and handling it in his hands as he examined it, Eddy reflected on how his old trusty axe had come through for him so many times in the past. The solid metal axe was too large to be handled by any man.
Catching Eddys eye, he looked down to the floor, past the blade of his axe, to the strange energy traveling through the intricately woven metal. Using all of his senses one by one, Eddy looked for clues where to begin looking for Grizz.
A telepathic notion told him to look past a series of tall crystal cylinders. Though Eddy approached the crystal cylinders with his axe, the thought never crossed his mind to chop and destroy his way through the alien space station. Gently leaning his axe against the wall, Eddy worked his powerful volk fingers between the center of the crystal cylinders. Flexing and forcing his powerful volk strength, Eddy, with the drive of a diesel engine, spread the crystal cylinders apart like a curtain.
What he saw on the other side was like a giant tunnel section of a short stretch of road way. At each end of the road was a swirling portal of energy. Giant alien creatures were materializing out from one swirl at high speed and running or sometimes even flying through to the other swirl where they darted in fearlessly and dematerialized. The short stretch of road was like a two lane highway and the creatures who used it were not easy to see because they were traveling through so quickly.
Things are always getting weirder and weirder as I go. Eddy said to himself. I must be dreaming. Slapping himself in the face with the hopes of waking up from a strange dream, Eddy became aware that the fast moving alien creatures had quickly slowed to a stop and turned their great eyes to look at him.
Telepathically, the creatures were even more intrusive and overpowering as they looked through my mind.
The alien creatures were hideously strange. They had bone plated skin with many spikes at random like the armored hide of a crab. Its legs were like pinchers and its single eye cluster was at the end of its long retractable neck. Where its stomach was expected to be it had a great vertical mouth. At the back of the creature was a thick appendage which connected the creature to a great shell where likely was housed its vital organs and brain. The shells were each very different. Some were smooth while others were spiky and rough with a variety of colors. At the bottom of the great shells were spider-like legs. No two aliens looked the same and at the same time it was not easy to tell them apart. 
The high speed activity quickly slowed to a stop as the portals also stopped swirling and became came to a halt like the stillness and depth of space. No one came through the portals from that point and each of the creatures raised their eyes telescopically and fixed their extrasensory attention on Eddy.
Eddy stopped slapping himself realizing he could not wake up because he wasn't sleeping and opened his dark eyes wide at the giant aliens as they moved toward him. Eddy turned to duck back into the cargo hold but a powerful telekinetic force seized his body. The telekinesis seemed to be the invisible extension of the alien creature's clawed hand and held Eddy too tightly at his waist. With his hands on the crystal cylinders, Eddy challenged the strength of the alien creature. Pulling himself into the chamber slightly, Eddy was able to grab hold of the handle of his axe before he was over powered by the alien creature.  
Eddy was pulled out to the crowded roadway where he was tossed. With a controlled tuck and roll landing, Eddy sprang to his feet and brandished his axe in a defensive pose. While fully prepared to protect himself against the ugly creatures, telepathic communication began to ease into his mind, We are Morguldeans. We are superior to you but we do not wish to hurt you. Relinquish your weapon and come with us peacefully and we will take you to your companion.
Eddy replied to the Morguldeans with the same method of telepathy, Your terms are not the same as my own. How about, I keep the weapon and you go find my companion for me. Dont try intimidating me. I dont care how big you are or how smart you think you are. I have come too close to my goal to have the likes of you stand in my way now. With a swagger of confidence and attitude, Eddy could see how his thoughts caused the Morguldeans to consider rethinking their calculations for a moment.
Without hesitation, the Morguldeans moved to attack Eddy, but with equal speed and precision, Eddy swung his axe into action and began lopping limbs off the Morguldeans as they advanced on him. The dismembered large arms and spider legs caused the creatures to reel in pain and clumsily they retreated from Eddy to a distance out of reach.
Eddy eyed the creatures like a fine tuned weapon of expert skill. The wounded Morguldeans collected their severed body parts and began putting them back in place like they would heal up instantly. Even their thick yellowish blood slowly bled back into the wounds. Other Morguldeans held small devises which were used to shine a light on the wounds of the wounded and finalize the healing process. 
All of the Morguldeans reorganized themselves and held new positions brandishing weapons pulled from their shells. The weapons were constructed each with its own variance, but basically they were long golden rods with smaller metal rods twisted in and around them. With the sound of multiple slow raised chirps, the energy weapons of the Morguldeans charged up. Disks formed under the spider legs as some of the Morguldeans rose off the street and traveled over head in the high tunnel. 
That stung, volk. They knew of Eddys species. We can re-attach our severed limbs and heal any wound. It is time we return the favor, and for your sake you better be able to do the same. The Morguldeans blinked with their haunting singular eye lids, never letting Eddy out of their sight.
You want a piece of me? Eddy taunted the Morguldeans, Come over here and take it. Eddy finished by speaking standard words. In no time, the Morguldeans fought like they were as good as new. Eddy began to shout as he ran at the Morguldeans. 
Eddy planned to slide under the Morguldean nearest him as he raised his axe blade enough to score a long laceration and let the internals from the shell hang out from the opening. 
Instead, as Eddy charged at the Morguldean he was suddenly seized and captured with both telepathy and telekinesis. Evon, can you protect me from the mental powers of these creatures? through clenched teeth, Eddy questioned his sertz.
The small robot came shooting out of Eddy's ear and answered, I AM ABLE TO BLOCK THE ABILITIES OF THESE CREATURES, MY LORD.
Block them! Block them! Eddy commanded before he dropped from mid air. Both, the telepathy and telekinesis vanished from any hold over him any further.
Evon, the sertz continued to fly near to Eddy as it resonated a hypersonic frequency which disabled some of the Morguldean's abilities.
Using the slope and spikes of the shell, Eddy climbed up to the top of the wounded Morguldean. As the volk leaped from the shell, one of the hotshot Morguldeans tried to shoot at Eddy, but his weapon missed and only further injured the wounded Morguldean.
From a spinning bound in low G, Eddy elbowed one of the Morguldeans right in its great eye. As he used the leverage from his lightning quick attack, he saw how the eye was a definite weak spot as the entire creature instantly recoiled into its shell with a terrible shriek. Knowing where to strike the creatures to cause them the most pain Eddy quickly round housed the next Morguldean in its eye as he shouted, Evon! Target their eyes.
The little robotic sertz began shooting tiny colorful stars, hitting multiple Morguldeans right in their eye. The Morguldeans quickly recoiled into their shells so quickly and with such force the shells spun around in the low gravity as a field of protective living energy began to glow around them.
Though Eddy was a very large volk with huge muscles which were unproportional to that of human, he was still capable of maneuvers conducted with incredible speed and strength. One after the other, Eddy began striking the Morguldeans eyes rapidly. With each eye that was struck, the Morguldeans would retract instantly into their shells. The Morguldeans quickly realized Eddys plan for a skillful and tactical attack on their eyes and began protecting themselves. Most of them retracted their eyes into their bodies as far as they could so they were still able to see. 
When Eddy leaped through the air again, he landed on the road with a tuck and roll before slipping unnoticed into the crowd and hiding underneath one of the Morguldeans. With the sertz blocking the telepathic attempts of getting inside Eddys mind, the Morguldeans became very agitated. The huge dark portals were active again as they started swirling. As a precaution, many of them backed into the portals at each end of the two lane street. As seconds ticked by, the Morguldeans grew more anxious and paranoid.
Climbing up the back of one of the Morguldean's shells, Eddy straddled it holding on tightly to its spikes. An energy field formed around the entire creature as it lifted off the floor and began to fly. Riding it like a flying turtle, Eddy Lurched forward and became a stowaway along for the ride to where ever as the Morguldean ventured right into one of the rolling black portals.

Instantaneously, Eddy found himself popping out of the other end of the portal where he found himself amongst an entirely different place. He had been transported near the top of the inside of the space stations dome. Far below him was the encased planet of the Morguldeans. Oh, great, now Im really lost. Eddy thought as he took in the magnificent sight of Morguldean civilization far below me. Though Eddy didnt want to remain at such a dangerous altitude above the cities, he wasnt particularly thrilled about descending closer to one of them.
The Morguldean dived down toward the encased planet's surface. They passed by floating mechanical stations and through clouds before a mysterious telepathic message came to Eddy's mind. Follow my voice and you will find me. Spoke a thought to Eddys mind, only this thought was not intrusive as the other Morguldeans had been. This thought was not the same at all. Eddy could relate to the mind behind the thought like it was somehow relative to his own. For a moment he considered the thought came from Grizz, but Grizz was always far too aggressive to be so warm and subtle.
The Morguldean's telescopic cluster eye extended over it's back and gazed at Eddy as Eddy was aware that the Morguldean had received the same telepathic message and it decided to follow the same voice which spoke to Eddy's mind. Lured to a specific building of the Morguldean world, Eddy and the Morguldean were then directed to a specific window.

The whole incident began to bother Eddy as he suspected if this was a method of misleading trickery which had captured Grizz.
Eddy neared the window where they were telepathically directed to, where he noticed someone inside looking out at him from what looked like a control room window. Steadily, the Morguldean carefully brought Eddy near to the window of the dark control room. 
The single being within the control room was not a Morguldean. The dark hooded and cloaked person at the center of the room was actually a human-like body. While Eddy observed from behind the window, he saw the human-like form was very small next to the large alien counters and strange consoles. As though waiting for Eddy to do something, the mysterious person stood looking right back at him. The mysterious person moved forward until he was under the tall counter and Eddy couldnt see him anymore. A hand reached up over the counter and flipped a switch.
The window vanished and the Morguldean used a telekinetic ability to carry Eddy inside. Noticing the inner compartment had gravity, Eddy settled his feet carefully on the counter. Cautiously, Eddy looked at the Morguldean, then down to the cloaked figure and back again. Hello? Eddy spoke to the cloaked figure, carefully placing his axe on the counter. My name is, Eddy Evon. I will not harm you. He spoke in Basic English hoping the creature would respond to the tone of his voice at least.
The cloaked figure waved his hand with a telepathic message for the Morguldean outside the window to depart. When the Morguldean flew away, the window re-appeared. Eddy craned his neck to look over the counter-top. 
Peace, you are welcome here for I would not harm my friends. Spoke a voice from the dark and mysterious hood. You may know me as, Jupacious. The cloaked figure slid his hood back, exposing his face for the first time. Jupacious looked up and a faint light revealed the face of the voice. Jupacious was a volk. When Jupacious pushed back the cowl from over his head and the first thing Eddy realized was how thin and old this volk was. Eddy recognized a strange peace in this volks eyes. If it was a trap, Eddy would be drawn in easily. The eyes of Jupacious were so strange and deep, magnificent and mysterious at the same time. Those eyes Strong but gentle, somehow familiar, looking deep into his soul Those eyes... You do not belong here. I am supposed to be the only volk of this time.
Perhaps it is the both of us who are not supposed to be here. I am not aware of other volks unless they too are time travelers. Eddy spoke with a wise nod of his head. Tell me how you came to be here.
Time traveler, yes, I am also a dimensional traveler. My story is rather unbelievable. I will surely answer any question you care to ask, but because you are new here, I prefer you start with your story. The look in the old volks dark eyes was taunting Eddy to begin opening up.
Ill tell you my story, but Im concerned for my companion. Im searching for Grizz. Do you know where I can find him? Eddy swallowed and squinted his eyes skeptically.
I have been watching him and following where the Morguldeans are taking him. Jupacious answered, and pointed to a three dimensional view screen on the console with perfect clarity. There, they saw the Morguldeans with Grizz in a chamber. Grizz had been bound and put into a clear capsule shaped container. Through the instruments they were able to conduct many scans to assist them as they followed Grizz. The Morguldeans and their scans are harmless. Notice also how your companion, Grizz, is not frightened. We have to wait for them to finish before we can see him.
How can you be so forgiving? The Morguldeans are not good creatures, they are evil. Eddy shook his head with disappointment.
You are new here and you do not yet understand the Morguldeans. They are an honourable race and they can be very helpful to us if you know how to speak to them. Jupacious explained.
Will they want to examine me? Eddy asked nervously.
No, you are a volk. The Morguldeans know our kind through the examinations conducted on me, but this creature, Grizz, is strange. Is he a volk?
Not exactly. Eddy told him.
Jupacious wasnt too interested in Grizz as he waved the thought away. In the meantime I would like for us to talk. You are a stranger to me, yet everyone has a story, where they came from, the places they have been and the creatures they have encountered. I would like very much for you to tell me your tale. Eddy noticed a small object covering the left ear of Jupacious. Pointing at the half round black object at the side of his head, Jupacious said, Your sertz can connect to this and send me your thoughts speedily.
Strange. thought Eddy. This volk seems to know more than I first realized. I cant wait to find out his story. I have only ventured half of the journey set before me. I dont believe Ive completed the known distance of space and time to return to my home, yet this volk is here and he has technology equal to my own. He not only knows of sertz but he knows I have one as well So where is his? Eddy was going to question Jupacious at first but it occurred to him a test of his first expression would tell more than a well worded explanation.
Evon. spoke Eddy as he called for his sertz. From Eddys ear flew the tiny robot.
It was designed with a tiny chiseled floating body with a tiny head directly on top. The head turned as it looked around briefly before it examined Jupacious; finally it slowed to a stop beside Eddy at eye level. It fixed its little red glowing eyes on Eddy. I AM HERE, MY LORD.
Eddy examined the eyes of Jupacious to find a glimmer of surprise or malice but all he found was a smile. Jupacious; amused at the little sertz whom Eddy named Evon, but the sertz only captured his attention for a brief moment before his eyes locked onto Eddy once again. Eddy noticed a strange sense of wonder in the eyes of the old volk.
Pleased by what he saw in Jupacious, Eddy decided to trust his instincts and befriend him. Shifting his gaze to his sertz, Eddy said, I wish to telepathically link with Jupacious. He is wearing a device on his head. I need you to remote interface with this device.
VERY WELL, MASTER. Evon replied loyally. Circling around Eddys head once as it conducted a flight scan before the sertz flew into Eddys ear and began establishing the link.
Peering back at Jupacious, very serious now, Eddy said, I have to start my tale from the beginning. It begins with my father, Mulunac. The link was created and the information from Eddys mind began to transmit. For Eddy it was a time to relive his life before he left it all behind.

It was by design and purpose how life was allowed to continue living. Great heroes, creatures capable of doing impossible feats, have come and gone throughout our history. Amongst the greatest beings to have ever lived was my father.
Mulunac; the leader of a thrustle-T battalion. In a time long set before us on the peaceful planet of Verticus, my father was one of the few who was not only a noble volk serving the planet as a peace keeper under the protective authority and judicial responsibility of thrustle-T, but he was so unique and dedicated to his work, he was appointed first in front-line leadership rank. To accomplish this position, he had to prove himself superior among volks and the thrustle-T. Great was my fathers name and honor.
The armour worn by Mulunac covered a blue energy gel suit. The armour plating was a sparkling metallic red with a thick, clear, smooth finish. Waves of energy pulsed in movements of waves across the impenetrable red armour. Gold lined the edges of the armour and silver wings, framed in gold, pointed high at the sides of his helmet.
Strong features shaped Mulunacs powerful face, and every word he spoke seemed to hold a deeper meaning. His presence was like no other.
Verticus, my home world, a magnificent planet, yet if left to nature, without the help of volk intervention, it would have been destroyed many times over. It would have been not only a broken planet but incinerated all together. Across the surface of this unique world was a huge mechanical brace. It was wrapped around the entire surface of the planet along the equator. The purpose of such planetary prosthetics was primarily to allow the planet Verticus to leave its natural orbit around the sun to keep from venturing too close. At the natural proximity the planet would burn up, for the solar system was at a ripe old age and the sun, at a red giant stage. Besides keeping the planet a safe distance from the sun, the brace of Verticus was also capable of controlling weather conditions and aiding the planet in the calming of natural disasters. Nature can be a stubborn one to get along with no matter how much control one might establish over it. Weather tends to make its own rules. On the surface, volks share their dominance with huge insects of Verticus. 
Millions of years ago, dinosaurs dominated the planet, later mammals, with humans at the top of the food chain. In the time and space of Verticus, it was the insects who ruled. Volks were superior, but we can not compete with the rate at which insects breed. 
Many of the vehicles of the planet were created as replicas to blend in with the natural wonders of the planet. Most volks admired and greatly appreciated the natural design and color of the highly agile insects as insects were sought to be the next step in the evolution of volks.
Much of this world was peaceful, but evil was still capable of rearing its ugly face. Even in the lives of beings as superior as volks. It was amazing what a little confusion and misunderstanding could do.
Gastonish, a female volk or wovolk, renowned in the arts of peace keeping methods found favor in the eyes of Mulunac. Not only did the two of them work well together, they formed an allegiance which was so strong they became even more than best friends.
As much as possible, Gastonish wore a lot of items which incorporated electric pinks and purples. No outfit worked better for her than the skin tight pink energy gel suit which incorporated a circuit design that could shift and click with subtle movements. Though her bones were thick, her compact musculature accentuated her feminine power and beauty.
As time passed, their unique friendship grew into much more. It was only inevitable they would want to consummate their relationship with marital vows. At about this time, Zip, a sertz, relayed some ill-favoured news of a new line of thrustle-T, a lifeless robotic army who could take the place of a volks usefulness as a peace keeper. Due to safety and the superiority of the robots abilities, Mulunac was included amongst other field officers who would be put out of a job. But Mulunac did not worry about such problems. His mission of course was to live life to the fullest and do all of the things he was not ready to do before. He loved Gastonish more than anything else in the worlds and they decided to unite in a customary volk wedding of extravagant brilliance and beauty.

On the magnificent world of Verticus, of the Ied era, two volks were beginning a wondrous journey, celebrating life. Giant flying insects and vehicles of multiple shapes and sizes filled the expanse of the orange colored sky. Within their own Zandith Crockmior L/X, Mulunac and Gastonish traveled at a tremendous speed blurring the landscape of Verticus ridged crust. Heading toward the horizon of a vibrant red sunset they enjoyed the golden high-lights which surrounded them. The insect-like craft darted away from the planet as the surface rounded off from their precise straight-line trajectory. The buzzing of the insect vehicles wings began to glow brightly as they continued their journey. Passing through the atmosphere with ease and entering orbit, the passengers glanced back at their shrinking home world of Verticus. There they caught a glimpse of the bloated red sun which reminded them of a molten eye of anger ready to explode. Heads forward again, they looked-on to the future and the new life they would build with each other.
After leaving the ceremony of their wedding, excitement filled their strong young hearts and they raced against the speed of the adrenaline pumping through their veins. On a whim, they decided to shoot for the stars, literally. 
A destination was plotted into their course. A destination filled with benign beauty and bewilderment. Neither of the two beings navigated the organic craft, for it was operating by the self guidance system. Their two sertz were recording all movements by the craft. 
A sertz; a miniature robotic being approximately three millimeters squared in size. Each individual, in the Ied era, was issued a sertz. Each sertz served several purposes, such as identification, education, counseling and to serve as a protective guardian along with a dependable eye witness accountant, plus much more. A sertz will watch over and remember, in great detail, all of the activities of ones life. The sertz, with its miniature size of three millimeters, had no difficulty entering the ear. Once inside, the sertz painlessly anchored itself within the external acoustic meatus. The sertz are always careful not to damage the tympanic membrane (eardrum). Once installed, communication was possible. Between a personal sertz and sentient owner, speech was private and seemingly telepathic.
The organic on-board instruments of the Zandith Crockmior L/X, displayed nothing. No course heading, no speed of travel, nor was there any sign to measure the vehicles nourishment level. Only tendrils hung out toward the passengers like large glossy spider legs. Mulunac held a bulky metallic forearm monitor close to the tendrils. The spider legs twitched and stretch out for the monitor. Within reach, the organic tendrils plugged into some small holes. The monitor opened like a book and displayed countless readings for the passengers to observe.
The speed at which they traveled was the equivalence of a photon of light. Using an inhuman technology, the passengers doubled their speed. The effects of the sudden thrust and velocity was muffled, protecting the passengers so well they hardly noticed any change in speed at all. From their new speed they doubled it again and again. Traveling thirty times faster than the speed of light for one hour before the insectular vehicle began to decrease its speed.
A beautiful and popular planet of the Procyon solar system, the planet was called Tryserious. With a little help from Volks, the planet was stable, young and capable of sustaining any Verticus life selected for the peaceful planets criteria. Three days were spent at Tryserious as the couple enjoyed the pleasures of that world. Landscapes, vegetation, triple moons and wondrous night skies were all new to the Verthlings. They could not recall another time of their life when problems were as distant as the time they spent at Tryserious, on their honeymoon.
After three days, Mulunac had a strong desire to continue their voyage to a distant nebula, a nebula outside their own galaxy, The Genation nebula. Legend told tale how it was the birth mark of where everything in existence began. The very location from whence creation sprang to being.
Drawn to Genation, by a deep inner need, Mulunac was compelled to see it. His recent dreams spoke so clearly to him as well as a longing which went back further than he could remember. Genation was calling to him.
Many volks had come to the wondrous location but the excitement and popularity of this place had diminished over the years. After Mulunacs strange dreams of this place, he wanted simply to go, see it and quench his curiosity. Gastonish did not fully understand the fascination which drove him, but she agreed to join him. She would have agreed to join him no matter where he wanted to go.
The voyage through space was much like before, except they were beyond the stars. When they came to a stop, they found themselves gazing upon the spectacular sight of the nebula, Genation. It was an awesome sight. 
The Genation nebula; hundreds of thousands of times larger than our own galaxy and stranger than any other domain of space and time, a twin nebula harnessing raw powers in the most raw and purest living capacity. On one side a swirl moved clock-wise and glowed in a kindled fiery red while the other side swirled counter clock-wise and glowed with a deep icy blue radiance. An awesome expanse and at any close range it would appear that these twin expanses stretched out for all eternity and filled space entirely with its dominance of fire and ice.
From the center of the two gasses a spear of bright white light was projected through the centers. One spear pierces through the center of the red nebula maelstrom and another pierced through the blue. These two spears of light stabbed into the depths of space and fade out beyond sight.
The great nebulas were dressed in a single line of energy around their outskirts. Like a loose crumpled purple ribbon of energy, a line was made to not only surround the twins but through such a line the two spears of light were joined. Indeed the ribbon intersected the spears of light remaining ever distant from both the nebulas.
It is more wondrous than I imagined it in my dreams. Mulunac remarked. The organic insect craft shuddered and was thrown slightly as it passed through a solar electrical field. Systems were quickly compensated before the small energy wave was forgotten.
The journey to the nebula, with its two swirling oceans of red and blue was truly beautiful. They were observing the different aspects of the benign nebula, when a pair of brilliant blue lights of energy streaked past the Zandith Crockmior L/X from the right and headed off to the left. Mulunac instinctively ensued pursuit of the high speed objects.
Mulunac, those are probably just kids in some new type of hickoop. Just leave them alone. Gastonish insisted.
Even an experimental proto-type hickoop would have appeared in my close range sensors. If I observed them correctly, they were too small to be hickoops. Besides, so far my telepathic sensors read we are the only volks in this system. As a thrustle-T, it is my duty to investigate. I must pursue them.
But your time as a thrustle-T is as good as gone, Gastonish explained, Just let it go. but Mulunac felt even more compelled to make a point. He worked so hard all his life to be a great thrustle-T and he would not be replaced and forgotten so easily. Within seconds a great distance was covered in the pursuit of the blue spheres of energy and Mulunac found that he brought their insectular vehicle amazingly close to the nebula and the purple ribbon of energy which surrounded it. There, he discovered the dozen small blue spheres of light situated together in a tight cluster but they were not moving. Mulunac slowed their craft quickly. Telepathic sensor readings still could not locate the blue spheres of energy which were clearly right in front of them. 
The purple glowing energy ribbon which encircled the nebula slightly brightened as they moved closer to it. Once the vessel began to move through the purple glow of the enormous energy ribbon, their sensor sweep revealed the purple glowing expanse of the ribbon was composed of countless free floating energy crystals of mass. These were the objects which gave off the purple glow and they made up the structure of the ribbon. From the craft, Mulunac and Gastonish watched the countless small crystals moving past them on either side. The purple energy crystals, which were no bigger than hand held stones, easily numbered greater than the grains of sands from Verticus. When they moved right through the purple field entirely, Mulunac noticed the cluster of blue energy spheres were beginning to move toward them. The greatest difference between the Purple chrystals and the blue spheres was the blue spheres moved with a sense of purpose and intelligence.
In an instant, the Zandith Crockmior L/X came to a sudden stop. Mulunac was baffled. I did not bring this vessel to a stop. The occupants were trying to determine the cause of their suspense. It was as though they were held in the grasp of an unseen power. There was a strange silence and calmness of the Genation nebula. The cluster of strange blue energy spheres dispersed in separate directions and disappeared. The incredibly large energy ribbon had somehow captured the craft. With the appearance of a wasp, the craft struggled to be free from the purple energy ribbon like a bug stuck to fly paper. The ribbon forced them along its windy path no differently than if they were at the mercy of a river's current. The ribbon of purple energy led the Zandith Crockmior L/X to the strong spear of light which stabbed through the heart of the blue swirling nebula twin.
The interior cockpit of the Zandith Crockmior L/X had its own enunamic field of gravitational force. Therefore, any movement experienced by the ship was non-existent to those encased within the cockpit.
Mulunac tried everything, working against the controls to escape the ribbons hold, but the vessel was powerless to the mysterious force. The Zandith Crockmior was un-willfully dragged into the great spike of light. At first contact with the light, the Zandith Crockmior L/X, and the two passengers within it, were instantly pulled into the nebulas glowing core. The light of the core surrounded them as they entered it. The journey seemed to have no end, as if they were being pulled in further than the cores mass.
Mulunacs body froze-up in some sort of paralysis. His body, like stone, became frozen and his deep black eyes were fully opened like he was in shock. Gastonish, tried to shake him out of it and shout at him but nothing worked. Gastonish, decided to take control of the Zandith Crockmior. For the giant female to have manual control, she had to link her mind to the cerebellum of the Zandith Crockmiors mind. This process became possible when she plugged an organic tendril into her helmet. By doing this, Gastonish allowed her thought to have direct control of the Zandith Crockmiors cerebral cortex which was the connection to the center of intellectual activity. With all of her efforts, the wovolk was still unable to control the insectular vehicle.
It was shot straight through to the other side of the blue nebula. It covered a great distance at such a high speed, it was almost instantaneous. The Zandith Crockmior L/X had movement and Gastonish regained control. A calm voice began to speak from within the wasps matrix. TURBULENCE AHEAD, The synthetic voice warned. LIGHTNING TO THE NINTH POWER AND POINT FOUR SOLAR HURRICANE STRENGTHS.
Shot out of the nebula from the other side, the Zandith Crockmior L/X drifted free from the powerful light. At the same moment, Gastonish found she had control over the Zandith Crockmior L/X, Mulunac awoke from the spell he was under. It was as though someone flipped a switch and Mulunac was himself again. The two romantics found themselves in the middle of the predicted storm. Surrounded by the blue flames of an explosion, Mulunac observed. We are within a field of fire. As they looked around, they found in the distance were two stars. Mulunac looked at the stars and felt a chill run through his twin spines. It is like those stars are eyes, Mulunac made the startling comparison, And they are looking right through me.
As Mulunac stared into the glowing eyes of the stars, Gastonish observed how he began to change. His expression became hard and anger filled his eyes. A roar from outside shook the insectular craft and Mulunac responded with a great roar of his own. 
Mulunac was aware of some other activities moving toward them and it seemed like the Genation nebula was reaching out toward them with a great ghostly blue tendril like arm. As it neared them it was apparent it was a glowing blue cloud. In a very short time the cloud had come through the wall of fire which surrounded them. The cloud passed through the hull of the Zandith Crockmior. Countless blue spheres of energy were dancing around them within the cockpit. Mulunac relaxed and became extremely calm and tried to examine the little blue shires of light. These lights were like the twelve which made up the cluster previously and these moved around extremely fast. Mulunac waved his hand through the cloud and the little lights interacted with him. The strange cloud was harmless, Mulunac tried to move away, but the little blue lights became agitated and swept him up. They swarmed around him forsaking any and all other things of the near area. The little lights began to be absorbed by Mulunac until his body was so full of them his grey flesh began to glow. The other little blue lights which flew about, formed a sphere around Mulunac. 
Gastonish was very worried about her husband as the spheres of energy held her at bay, Mulunac, try to reach out to me! Gastonish tried to reach out to Mulunac but the little blue lights of living energy were too powerful and continued to push her back. The sphere which was formed around Mulunac began to take up a lot of space in the small cock-pit. Gastonish was being pushed to the side by the field of energy around Mulunac and Mulunac became too bright, blindingly bright. Gastonish felt the unseen pressure of being crushed against the wall until the energies surrounding them began to phase Mulunacs bright body into a ghostly form. The items Mulunac wore fell through his body to the organic padding of the cock-pit. In a ghostly fashion, Mulunac was carried right out of the Zandith Crockmior through the hull of the Zandith Crockmior L/X. A similar stunned expression was upon each of their faces and Mulunacs powerful body was paralysed and frozen stiff. 
This terrified Gastonish as she was not used to seeing Mulunac weak or powerless. His glowing body, charged with power, phased right through the hull. He was carried outside, right into the heart of the rolling and flickering fires which surrounded them. 
Gastonish looked out of the frontal viewer and placed her hands against it. She cried out to him but her efforts were futile. She could not help but to believe the fire outside was controlled under some sort of intelligence. She saw how the strange surrounding fire moved away and how it watched them from a distance with burning bright wide eyes. Lunging forward fiercely, the cloud of fire came at Mulunac like a great mouth to devour him, but the blue energy orbs which surrounded and penetrated Mulunac, took him away like the streak of a great comet. Gastonish watched as the comet escape the red kindling fire, though her husband was likely burning up inside of it.
Having her soul mate ripped from her was equal to a grievous physical pain. Gastonish felt she would bleed love and heart ache for the rest of her life.
Gastonish wasnt sure where she was anymore. She noticed the red and blue swirls of the Genation nebula no longer existed. What she beheld was a very different nebula. It was a purple nebula of inter woven gases and glowing clouds. Two spears of light intersected through the heart of the nebula like a great X. She recognized the spears of light. They were exactly like the ones from the Genation nebula. She wondered, for a moment if it were possible this was the same nebula at all.

The comet was moving so fast it almost disappeared into the distance trailing a long white tail. From the great expanse of red fire came a second comet which chased close behind the white comet. The pursuing red comet seemed to be eating the white comets long tail as it gained on it in speed. Even as far away as the white comet was, the tail and pursuing red comet could just barely be seen by the eyes of Gastonish. As she followed it she noticed the distant scar across the deep black beyond was turning slightly. It became more obvious as the arc of white tightened its course change. Unable to pass through the surrounding frontier which acted as an invisible border, the two speeding lights of red and white turned back inwards. It was apparent the strange comets were returning. Gastonish panicked. The path of the hostile burning comet passed right through the area of where Gastonish was. She barely had time to move out of the way.
The comet slammed into the middle of the great X of light beams which were at the center of the purple nebula and the hydrogen gases flared up in a great flash of fire. Close behind the comet, the expanse of fire flew in and exploded as well. This second explosion was far greater than the first.

No!!! Mulunac!!! Gastonish shouted. Mulunac was gone, but he was taken so quickly it didn't seem real at all. Only, what was real was how alone she was within the Zandith Crockmior L/X.

Chapter 2

Directly in front, through the darkness, Gastonish could see the black of space again. Mulunac, was gone. A series of shock waves rocked the Zandith Crockmior. Gastonish was overwhelmed and did not feel she was experienced enough to pilot the space craft out of the explosive conditions so she surrendered the controls to her sertz. When the Zandith Crockmior L/X was freed from the solar nebula force which held her, she punched the control functions back on line. The volks of the 268,648th century were rarely overwhelmed for long. Their technology provided countless options to muscle their way through the toughest conditions.
Gastonish looked back and noticed the nebula was different now, different and similar. On one side was the birth of a swirling red nebula with one of the great spears of light stabbing through the heart of it and beside it, swirling in the opposite direction was a new blue nebula of equal size. These were the twin nebulas of contrast which existed in opposition to one another. The blue swirl also had a spear of light stabbing through the center of it as well and a purple haze or ring surrounded it all.
It was an awesome sight. Twin Eddys in space. she thought, larger than any known galaxy and a sight in which Gastonish hoped to never see again in her lifetime. Though it comforted Gastonish to be able to recognize the Genation nebula, she was still at odds with how it managed to change so quickly. Little did she know, but what she had witnessed was how the red and blue twin swirls came to be. This incredible site held no value or interest for her. She needed to grieve for the loss of her newly wedded husband.
Immediately, the Zandith Crockmior guided itself away from the Genation nebula and began its journey back home to Verticus.
As she traveled once again multiplying the speed of light, she tried to make sense of what happened. Gastonish could not help herself but to feel fatigued with unanswered questions. She was too overtaken by the reality of her new marital relationship. The reality where such an unexplainable event had taken it all away did not seem real at all. Gastonish just wanted to concentrate on getting back to Verticus But she knew it would have to be done alone. She fought inwardly against feelings of being cheated.
The journey began to slow as she entered her home galaxy. Gastonish, quickly gained strength, and punched-up a virtue image of Verticus on her forearm unit. She wondered if her equipment was malfunctioning as she noticed different shapes and positions of basic landscape patterns. Wondering for a moment if she was truly still on a course heading for Verticus, she peered deeper into the image and chewed on her lower lip, trying to get a closer look. Xonox, I need you to check all systems of my instruments. She spoke out to her sertz. It seems we have been directed to the wrong planet.
TRUE, THIS IS NOT VERTICUS. The sertz acknowledged. BUT BESIDES THE APPARENT CHANGES, ALL READINGS OF OUR LOCATION REVEAL OTHERWISE. Xonoxs little vibrational voice sang forth with a hint of a digitized echo.
With my instruments damaged, I can't pin-point any of our known planets or stars, but this is supposed to be where Verticus is. I need to call for help and repair the romstrunn, Zandith Crockmior or whatever it is that's damaged. Why are you not updating me of the changes which have brought Verticus to this point? Gastonish breathed a sigh and gazed out at the yellow sun in thought.
I HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO ESTABLISH CONTACT WITH ANY OF OUR KNOWN SOURCES SINCE WE ARRIVED, ROMLESSA. The little sertz explained.
This is most strange. Gastonish scratched her head, We better go down to the planet's skin and find out what we have missed. Ill have to explain to the thrustle-T what happened to Mulunac. Your version is not adequate on its own. The graphic representation of the Zandith Crockmior had just passed through the atmosphere of the strange planet and moved like a photon of light, low over the surface. They flew over a large body of water to the land and crossed the land mass from east to west in a very short frame of time. Halt! commanded Gastonish.
The Zandith Crockmior responded by hovering motionless above a small farming community. Its wings buzzed in a blurry, vibrant motion. Within the cockpit Gastonish leaned forward from her shell like chair and crawled over the pillowy, warm organic cushion to get a better look, the large cushion was comfortable for smooth safe travel. She stared in wonderment and shock at the unidentifiable culture below. Her eyes grew wide at the absence of so many sights she expected to see but couldnt. She saw a thick green forest which grew around the outskirts of a grassy field. She was fascinated at the simple sight of cows grazing in the tall grass. When she was about to move closer to the brilliant red of a barn, a cow mooed loudly at the huge flying insect. Gastonish steered the vehicle away. The motion and complex agility of the Zandith Crockmior scared the cows off to the other direction. The intrusion only lasted a brief five seconds before Gastonish plugged her helmet in and took control of the Zandith Crockmior. She drove the craft into the sky and disappeared amongst the clouds.
Only a couple of children noticed the giant wasp hovering in the air over vacant farm land, but they were not the only witnesses. A nearby air-force base also noticed the Zandith Crockmior. They tracked it on their radar screens. Unsure whether to label it as some strange new missile or some other potential threat, the Commander immediately ordered three Tom Cat jets to dispatch and investigate the UFO.
Above the clouds, motionless, hovered the Zandith Crockmior L\X. Xonox, I cannot identify this world. Gastonish spoke with thought as she observed.
I CAN NOT PROVIDE THE ANSWERS YOU SEEK UNTIL WE MAKE CONTACT OF SOME SORT. Stated Xonox as the little mechanism searched its contact capabilities only to find no response. Falling back on its protocol, Xonox calculated choices to an adaptation for the situation. 
Gastonish caressed her cheek as she started wondering, We should be able to use our distance from the Genation nebula to give us an idea of our location? I cant depend on the stars when they too seem to be out of order.
Gastonish picked up Mulunacs romstrunn which remained lying beside her. She opened the device like it was a book. The Romstrunn was a comprehensional data filled unit which held more information than the largest library in the world. It was capable of three dimensional interactive projections and uncondensed fragmented sound. The sertz flew into the Romstrunn to allow for quicker, easier communicational translation. Soon, Gastonish came to the conclusion: Even with the aid of my sertz, the results are the same. By these readings, this planet should be Verticus; however, this solar system is different.
Behind the Zandith Crockmior three military jets eased up from beneath the clouds, about fifty miles away. These three tactical fighter jets were the air forces F-14D Super Tomcats. They were dispatched to investigate the unidentified aircraft. Again, Gastonish plugged herself into the controls. The Zandith Crockmior knew the jets were approaching and flew into their flight path. Gastonish stopped, hovering in mid-air, waiting for them, thinking the jets would also stop and give her answers, but they didn't even slow down. Instead, they flew dangerously close to the Zandith Crockmior. As they passed by, the pilots had a real eyeful as they tried to determine a positive and accurate identification. Guiding the Zandith Crockmior, Gastonish watched as the jets sped off into the distance. Gastonish did not intend to give up. She wanted answers or some kind of logical explanation. Immediately, she shuttled to a position above the lead F-14D. The legs of the Zandith Crockmior lowered and clinched the jet to slow it down. I've never seen a machine like this before. The bewildered Gastonish remarked. It is as though we are the first of our kind to discover this planet.
The other two jets became distracted and broke formation. The Wing-Leader contacted his command and informed them of their present situation. The Wing-Leaders commanding officer permitted them to engage the UFO with ammunition only. The jets on either side of the Zandith Crockmior became hostile and opened fire with their 20mm M61A1 Vulcan six-barrel cannons. The pilots were eager to drill the monster insect with their full capacity, 675 rounds of ammunition. Agitated rapid fire sprang forth with bullets the size of large zucchinis capable of piercing the armor of a tank. A few shots grazed passed the head of the Zandith Crockmior and clipped off one of the antennas. The receptacles which relayed the message to Gastonish of the damage was translated as simulated pain. Gastonish was frustrated and stuck the enormous stinger, from the abdomen of the Zandith Crockmior, into the jet. The stinger, 16 meters long, ripped through the hull of the Tomcat between its pair of F110-GE-400 after-burning turbofans and caused an explosion of fire and thick black smoke. The cockpit window of the jet burst into the underside of the Zandith Crockmiors head and the pilot ejected. The thrusters of the seat shot the pilot up and over the giant insects head. The Zandith Crockmior let go of the F-14D and let it plummet to its destruction where it crashed into the mountains below.
The Zandith Crockmior was out numbered and out gunned. Since it was more of a recreational vehicle than a weapon, it was no match against the air-force. Gastonish did her best to dodge the shots from an incoming F-14D. Rather than fleeing, Gastonish headed toward the jet swooping to the right of it. As the jet was moving to pass by, Gastonish stretched out the long legs of the Zandith Crockmior and caught a hold of the jet. The Zandith Crockmior pulled away with the momentum of the jet. Gastonish continued to fight with the Tomcat pulling it this way and that to get a feel for its strength.
Meanwhile, the other F-14D Tomcat rolled in from behind to fire upon the Zandith Crockmior. He attempted to wound, what looked to him to be a monstrous sized wasp. If he could do this he would remove it from off his comrade. 
Gastonish rolled the Zandith Crockmior forward as the incoming F-14D air-craft opened fire. Gastonish forced the nose of her captive Tomcat down. The Zandith Crockmior rolled up-side-down, all the while holding onto the Tomcat and forcing it in to a somersault. Finally, the Zandith Crockmior kicked the Tomcat away, hurtling it into the flight path of its comrade. The two F-14Ds collided into a violent blaze of fire.
What planet is this? Gastonish asked.
I CAN NOT ANSWER YOUR QUESTION UNTIL I HAVE MADE CONTACT WITH HIVE CENTRAL. answered her little robotic sertz.
She considered leaving the planet, but it was probable her answers may simply be over looked. Further investigation was essential to finding a prompt certifiable answer. 
The Zandith Crockmior surveyed the land flying low and fast. Gastonish was intent on visually sweeping over the beautiful mountainous surroundings. As she traveled between two steep Rocky Mountains, following a freshwater creek to a long waterfall, the Zandith Crockmior halted at the sight of a suspension bridge. The long iron bridge joined a freeway across the deep gorge. All vehicles, commercial and domestic, were clearly distracted at the sight of the Zandith Crockmior. They veered off and swerved causing a minor vehicle fender bender.
Gastonish was intrigued by the vehicles and even more so when the people stepped out. She observed from within the Zandith Crockmior and was confused at the sight of the human species. What is that? Gastonish asked, but her sertz came back with no reply. Obviously she was faced with a great mystery. She tried to confirm her voyage so she had the proper star system and galaxy.
The head of the Zandith Crockmior moved in closer so Gastonish could get a better look, but the humans ran in fear shouting and screaming. The wings of the insect vehicle thumped rapidly like a low hum. The residual wind caused a small smart car to overturn on the bridge.
A new squadron of air-crafts flew by over head. Gastonish backed the Zandith Crockmior away from the bridge and headed off in the direction of the new air force squadron. She snuck up on the jet fighters using the clouds to disguise her. As the Zandith Crockmior darted through the last cloud which was between them, the powerful wings broke the cloud apart swirling it away and vanishing. At about 15,000 feet above the mountain peeks, Gastonish realized the new squadron of three jets were different from the first.
These were A-10 warthogs. When they noticed the Zandith Crockmior quickly approaching them from behind, they broke formation and scattered. Two of the jets acted as decoys while the third came around to surprise the Zandith Crockmior firing bullets from its GAU-8A gun. 
Gastonish suspected such a maneuver. The wings of the Zandith Crockmior began to glow bright as it sped forward. Extending its stinger once more it cut the lead Warthog from tail to sternum with one swift stroke. The two TF34-GE-100 engines separated to either side of the craft and exploded. The stinger of the Zandith Crockmior could not rip the Warthog completely in half because of its titanium armour installations.
For a moment the stinger became lodged into the A-10s hull. Gastonish wrestled with the controls to break free. This gave the other warthogs time to reposition themselves and move in for the kill. The burning A-10 was pulling the Zandith Crockmior down as the other jets opened fire. The stinger was pulled free from the jet, but it was too late.
The bullets tore through the wings and through the synthetic hide of the Zandith Crockmior as though it was made of tissue paper filled with pudding. 
Xonox, again, we are under attack! We must leave! Be prepared to abandon this vessel! Gastonish commanded.
She gave one last attempt to regain control but when the A10 Warthogs turned on her to attack again, Gastonish quickly flipped a switch which started the larvae cycle. She touched the symbols which engaged a pod to protect the larva in a frozen state, before she escaped. She felt fatigued from all of the fighting.
She slid through the main exit of the Zandith Crockmior which entered the throat and stopped just before the opening of the mouth. She braced her feet against the maxillae and hoped the mandibles did not open before their time. At the mouth she activated her suit, which enabled her to float in an invisible radiance of an independent gravity field. Another shot punched through the Zandith Crockmiors side and the Zandith Crockmior coughed as a reflex to the damage. Coughed out, Gastonish fell away from the Zandith Crockmior. 
Though strong, the Zandith Crockmior was badly damaged with many gaping bullet wounds. The pilots couldn't understand why it didn't go down after so much punishment. Out of frustration, the attacking pilots showered ammunition at the head, or cockpit, and the thorax of the Zandith Crockmior. As the bullets struck their target, the strange insect craft was limply pushed by the force of each impact. The cockpit was shredded with a white fluid spurting rhythmically in all directions.
The A-10 warthog pilots were fighting with confused frustration and blind rage. Bullets continued to tear into the cockpit, and in the midst of the chaos they managed to miss seeing Gastonish float out of the insect craft. The Zandith Crockmior L/X fell toward a near by lake. Unfortunately the Zandith Crockmior was mutilated in the cross-fire of air force ammunition. It dived into a rolling spin leading a trail of white internal vapours. 
With the power of her suit, Gastonish paused in the air to turn back for a moment. She was not sure what kind of trouble she was even in yet. The vicious jets were following the Zandith Crockmior down to its doom until they broke off and turned to her direction. She snapped around, unable to watch the destruction of her vehicle any longer. She needed to get to the surface and find assistance. Unable to fly away by the power of her suit, Gastonish began to gently descend to the surface of the planet. Her suite provided the ability to defy gravity but it did not allow her to fly away. 
In the distance, the streaming sounds of jet thrusters were closing in. The formation passed by Gastonish and one jet in particular was so close the pilot made eye contact with her. Persistently, an A-10 warthog swooped in at Gastonish and made a visual identification of her humanoid form. The pilot veered hard to port and rolled around to come back at her again. It returned narrowly missing Gastonishs free floating body. Communications were made between the Air crafts.
Gastonish was terrified and looked down at the Zandith Crockmior as it spun, with injuries. Because it was in a spin it angled its descent and skidded down the slope of a steep mountain side. The wasp-like vehicle slowed. With its downward momentum, the Zandith Crockmior grazed along the rugged surface of the mountain side. The weight of the insectular units exoskeleton drove against the sharp rocks and trees as it plowed its way down the steep terrain. From Gastonishs distance she could see only the high dust being kicked up as the Zandith Crockmior scored its path toward the bottom.
Halfway down the mountain, the slope leveled out. The craft rolled a few times and its wings were shredded. Before the slope could level out fully, it dropped off at a cliff straight down to the lake below. As the stinger scored the mountain side, the dusty and torn Zandith Crockmior halted to a stop at the edge of the steep cliff. Anchored by its massive stinger the Zandith Crockmior was momentarily kept from any further abrasive descent. Its limp head lazily hung over the edge.
The two warthogs returned to make a fly-by surveillance run, but the last jet passed by too close and in its wake the mountain side was rattled. The thunderous echoing noise of the passing jets twin engines shook through the valley and started a rock-slide. A section of rock shifted under the Zandith Crockmior and began to disintegrate as it carried the Zandith Crockmior off the steep edged cliff. The Zandith Crockmior plummeted into the lake, hissing and bubbling as it sank below the surface. The slide added to the thunderous echo through the valley as it covered over the Zandith Crockmior and buried it deep under the lake. Gastonish was motionless staring down at the sunken Zandith Crockmior in shock. Practically, the entire side of the mountain let go and fell away. All which remained was a cavity filled with dust within a ten mile radius. The cloud of dust came up like smoke from a forest fire. A small lump of rubble marked a burial for the organic craft, at the base of the mountain where the deep lake met the shore. The lake's fathom swallowed most of the slide, but the top of the rubble would peek out for years to come.
Like a scared child, Gastonish remained floating in the air overwhelmed by the unfolding events. This was not her home. She was not sure where she was but she knew in her heart she was alone.
At length a military helicopter was tracking Gastonish and moving in for a capture or kill operation. Instinctively, Gastonish turned in mid-flight toward the thwumping sounds of an AH-64 Apache helicopter. With the appearance of a robotic dragonfly, the Apache was a twin engine, four bladed, multi-mission attack helicopter. Four Hellfire missiles and nineteen FFAR Hydra 70mm (2.75inch) folding fin aerial rockets hung off each side of it.
Gastonish shook like a dry leaf in the wind. The propellers chopping at the air with a violent force was anything but friendly in the fear stricken eyes of the wovolk.
Quickly, Gastonish pulled her disk away from her stomach and changed its shape, unfolding it into an odd, thinly framed vehicle. It had handles to hold, a seat to sit on and foot pedals. She straddled it like a bicycle which had no wheels. Once she was comfortably in place, a pink energy bubble appeared completely surrounding her. The energy bubble phased into view with equal speed to that of a light bulb being turned on, except the sound it made was like a digitized hiccup.
With the ability of her new vehicle, the helicopter was unable to catch her with its 30MM M230 automatic chain machine gun much less target her with ammo or even a missile lock, but they did not go without trying. Down the valley, great explosions erupted and echoed off the mountainous surroundings.
Gastonish did not have any weapons to retaliate with, besides she just wanted everything to end. She out maneuvered and out ran both the approaching Apache helicopter and the two remaining A-10 Warthogs. Flying low and fast over the land, Gastonish took her vehicle of energy through a small town. For a fraction of a second she was a visitor to the small country town. To those who noticed Gastonish, she was nothing more than a momentary pink flash of soundless light, a mysterious flash across the sky.
Continuing higher into the mountains, Gastonish found a secluded area. Turning in a wide loop through the sky, she descended upon a hunters remote summer cabin. Slowing to the ground, Gastonish keyed her energy bubble to disappear with the digital sound of a --hick-oop--. Gastonish folded her vehicle into its original disk form and re-attached it to the front of her abs. Cautiously, Gastonish searched the surroundings of the little log cabin for any hostile creatures. After finding the area was vacant, she sought refuge under the covered front porch. The shutters covering the windows were locked along with the front door. Her sertz examined the door knob. The little robot began to shoot small dots of light at the brass knob. Energy crackled over the surface of the brass as the metal began to disintegrate and dismantle on its own. Piece by piece the door knob fell apart until the door loosely opened. Squeaky hinges yawned like a drawn out cackle. Though scared senseless and wanting only to curl up some place and hide, Gastonish proceeded to search the inside of the cabin.
Confident she was truly alone, the constant thunder of military air-crafts searching for her made Gastonish very nervous. As she felt the shadow of loneliness creeping up on her, Gastonish realized the scope of just how deep her problem was. She was lost in space and stranded on a hostile, unknown alien world. Turning to her last and only friend, Gastonish began to confide in her sertz. Xonox, where do I go from here? Nerves on edge, Gastonishs voice shook out the question.
In response, her mite sized robot flew out from her ear and hovered before her. MAJESTY, THIS SITUATION LEAVES YOU WITH VERY FEW OPTIONS. THIS IS NOT THE WORLD WHICH WE ARE FROM AND NEITHER CAN I MAKE CONTACT WITH OUR VERTICUS COUNCIL OR HIVE CENTRAL. WE NEED HELP, BUT WE ARE STRANGERS HERE. I AM CAPABLE NOW TO ASSUME THE AUTHORITY OF ACTING THRUSTLE-T. Spoke the tiny female synthesized voice.
Thats enough for now Xonox, thank you. Gastonish told the little robot. My head feels hot and my body is going numb. She examined her shaky hand. Am I having a reaction to this worlds environment? I didn't adapt to this world. Am I going into shock?
Xonox directed Gastonish to a bed. YOUR BODY COMPOSION IS ONLY REACTING TO YOUR EXERTION. SO FAR THERE IS NO REASON FOR YOU TO HAVE TO ADAPT. LAY DOWN, MAJESTY, CONSIDER YOUR UNBORN CHILD. YOU WILL ACHIEVE NOTHING BY OVER WORKING YOUR EMOTIONS. REST NOW; I WILL DO WHAT I CAN TO PROTECT YOU. Drawing comfort from the familiar and reassuring feminine voice of her sertz, Gastonish took a deep breath and relaxed.
Letting her eyes look over the interior, Gastonish observed the little bedroom carefully. There was not much light in the room but three beams of sunlight were able to pierce their way through the tightly closed shutters. A pink glow from Gastonishs suit also contributed to the soft luminescence of the room. The bed was made of a wooden log frame with a single mattress on it with no sheets covering it. A single pillow was placed at the head of the mattress. One picture on the wall was of an elderly man holding up his latest catch, a large fish. Lightly, Gastonish touched the picture, running her fingers over the mans face. What kind of alien species is this? The emotion of the man depicted in the picture was happy for he was smiling. Gastonish spent a great deal of time examining the picture. It gave her a sense of new hope where there might be some good and intelligence to be found on this strange world. Searching the dresser drawers curiously, questioning the items of clothing she found, Gastonish went to the closet next and pulled out the items of clothing. After she had all of the clothes out of both the closet and dresser, Gastonish began to feel very tired. She was wiped out and drained of energy. Her attention came back to the picture on the wall. Lifting it off the nail, Gastonish wrapped her arms around it and held it close to her heart. Making her way to the bed where she laid down, Gastonish pulled the clothes over herself and let her head sink restfully into the pillow. Xonox. She called; the sertz was prompt to respond.
YES, ROMLESSA?
Restfully, Gastonish turned over in the bed and looked up at the ceiling. Lifting the black and white picture over her so she could observe it more, Gastonish said. I'm so tired. If the beings of this world come and find me, protect me, but try to remain inconspicuous. If we lure too much attention to our differences they may find me threatening and kill me. Like you said, I need help. I must try to make a peace with the inhabitants of this world if I am to find a way back home.
I AGREE, ROMLESSA, AND I SUGGEST IF THEY DO FIND YOU HERE YOU REMOVE YOUR SUIT, BOOTS, HELMET AND HICKOOP. HIDE THEM. PRESENT YOURSELF IN A NATURAL FORM AND DO NOT RESIST CAPTURE. PERHAPS IF YOU WEAR SOME OF THESE CLOTHES OF THIS WORLD YOU WILL BE ACCEPTED INTO THEIR CULTURE.
Gastonish sat up. These clothes? curiously Gastonish lifted a plaid shirt to her cheek and felt the material on her skin. She choked back a giggle at the thought of wearing the clothing of strange creatures. Gastonish hit a switch on her pink glowing circuit design helmet and the circuitry design of her suit peeled and interacted. All of the belongings Gastonish wore came apart and moved together as it all interchanged to take the form and function of a circuitry designed baggage-case. The floating visor of her helmet became a master lock and Xonox was the only key which could unlock it. Gastonish wore clothes found from within the cabin but they did not seem to fit her right. Too tall and muscular, and the bony plates of Gastonish's shoulders and forearms stretched the shirt and pants to their limits. Though she was uncomfortable and the tight fit was obviously not how the clothes were intended to be worn, Gastonish believed the disguise would allow her to pass as a human. Gastonish went to a mirror and examined herself in it. She held the black and white picture of the bald man up next to her face. Grey skin and hairless like the picture, in Gastonishs mind she would be able to fool the creatures of the planet. Perhaps they are some strain of volk. Gastonish pondered.
