I found myself enjoying it. I told her the areas of my back which were itchy and she willingly began scratching. Her efforts were helpful but soon I needed some serious scratching so I went to a large nearby rock and rubbed my back up against its rough surface. The scratching was satisfying but as always, I had to stop before the skin of my back was rubbed raw.
It was very dark when I heard the sound of a stick snap in the woods. I stood up. Sally also heard the sound. I concentrated and heard more sounds of rustling and it was from no wind. Whos there! I said clearly. Silence followed. Finally, I heard a distinct breath and a dry leaf was crushed. Sally moved around behind me and peeked out around the side of me. I bent down and picked up a rock. Im warning you, identify yourself. As Sally and I looked on, two distinct eyes could be seen reflected in the flickering flames of the fire. The sight of the eyes in such a secluded area really spooked us. I threw the rock at the eyes and a high pitched scream sounded like rubber tires skidding on pavement.
I ran into the woods after it and found I killed a wolf. I told Sally what it was and she was not happy. She was worried the whole thing would end up giving her nightmares.
Before long, I had parts of the wolf roasting over the fire. Sally wasnt going to eat any of it at first, but it smelled so good and after her first bite, she ate until she was stuffed. Resting back on the blanket, we ate more and drank strawberry soda in fancy wine glasses. As I bent forward to light a candle, Sally reached for some potato chips, and we lightly bumped our heads together. I looked up at the stars, and began to feel very thankful because I was there alone with Sally Coppler. I lowered my eyes to her and we smiled.
With our stomachs full, we gazed at the fire and I began to focus on Sally. I felt Sally was not enjoying the mood so I poked the fire and I asked Sally to take a look at the stars with me through my telescope.
I don't know astrology too well but I never have a problem finding Orions belt. She said truthfully.
Orions belt is fascinating. I told her. Three stars equal in apparent brightness at equal distance and all in a straight line. I thought for a moment. Perhaps those three stars are not there to represent a belt of a mighty human warrior.
Are you suggesting they are there to represent the belt of a mighty volk warrior? asked Sally with a naughty smile.
Not at all. I am merely speculating how the three stars could be a sign or clue of something much greater like a time line: the past, present and future.
Don't you think other astrologers have thought of that already?
Who can say. I assumed it was my idea. Sally was not one to entertain many of my notions for time and space so I tried to sway the conversation slightly. Some astrologers use cameras to study the stars. I told Sally. I like my telescope even though it only collects light from distant objects in the sky making them appear bright or larger. What I want to own one day is a spectroscope, because it breaks up the light from distant objects into lines. Astronomers studying the lines can tell what substances make up the distant objects. Recent scientists have made many new discoveries about the universe by using radio telescopes. I explained.
What exactly does an astronomer do for a job? Sally asked, thinking to be an astronomer couldn't be considered a normal job.
As an astronomer, I am gathering information and trying to answer many difficult questions with scientific facts. For example, why do the planets move as they do? What is the life history of a star? How did the universe come to be?
Do you really think you can find the answers?
I must try, the hardest thing will be to prove my answers. There is more to it than just finding answers. I also want to learn the history of Comets, meteors, meteorites, and tektites, constellations, eclipses, mars, the moon, observations, planetariums, planets, radio and radar astronomy, the solar system, stars, the sun, telescopes, time and the universe. I heard a theory where one could venture out faster than the speed of light and view a planets past.
But if you were to travel at the speed of light, your atoms would explode. Sally reminded me.
Exactly, which is why a body such as mine would travel within a pod made of an energized technology of its own gravitational enunamic field and an exterior anti-light field. Earth probably won't see it for another million or more years. To study the universe, we astronomers must use other sciences as well, like, physics, chemistry, and mathematics.
Well, you certainly seem to know your stuff about the stars. I don't even want to know where you acquired your information about things to be discovered on other planets. If you told me, I would probably be sent to another secluded Island, even worse than this one. Sally imagined.
I mostly speculate. Some of this will be a part of my studies for the school science fair. I told her. I will explain it better to you in the upcoming science fair which Mr. Dalton has us preparing for.
I guess you want to go to college or university?
Well, I said, I'm not sure yet, I want to do some traveling first. Most large countries have national observatories like in the United States I'd like to visit one in Washington. In Great Britain there is the Royal Greenwich Observatory at Herstmonceaux. In Australia, the national observatory is near Canberra, and in France it is in Paris. You see, many people believe space exploration is the way of the future, but I think spending billions of dollars on space crafts as well as the time it would take to travel the stars would be a phenomenal waist. We don't need to go anywhere. We can simply build better telescopes. One day I would like to build the ultimate telescope and I would have it built on the moon where I would not have to contend with a polluted atmosphere or weather.
Sally giggled, You wouldn't go to other planets? You'd just look at them?
One day space travel will become easier, but for now a telescope would be like turning on the lights in a dark room. Once you know what's out there, then you can decide where you want to go with more meaning than to just wander around in space.
Do you really think the government will ever allow you to leave this Island? Sally asked me with concern in her voice. I wondered if she had some kind of intuition about my feelings of being trapped on the Knolix Island or if it was just that obvious.
The government and I are at an agreement at the moment. It is best for everyone if I remain here on the Island, but if I decide to leave, I will go. If I do so for the sake of space exploration or colonization of another planet I believe I could be very helpful to such a project.
Maybe I can go with you to all of these telescopes, even other worlds. Sally dreamed.
It could be dangerous. I told her. I would not make such a promise to you, because if I do leave here one day, one possibility is how it could get very ugly. If something happened to you I could never forgive myself.
Well, I understand, I probably wouldn't be all that interested in the telescopes anyway, I just want to be with you.
I brushed her beautiful blond hair from her shoulder. How thoughtful of you, Sally. I placed my other hand on hers gently as we exchanged a glance and blushed. It actually felt rather awkward. Which brings me to an interesting question; Do you think you and I could or even should have a relationship? as soon as the words left my mouth, I wanted to take them back.
What are you saying? You're not going to dump me again are you? Sally became defensive. If it is meant to be then it is destiny and it will happen all on its own. You need to be more patient. Just look at us, here we are together again. Nothing can stop true love. Oh, ya, trust me to mess things up when they are going so well.
Okay, now just settle down. All I am saying is we may want to discuss how much we are willing to sacrifice for us. I tried to explain.
Eddy, this is only our first date. At this stage I think we should take things in stride. It would be different if we were married.
Did she say the M word? Married? I questioned silently to myself.
I would be with you through it all. Sally continued, No matter where you go or what you did, I would be right there with you.
Perhaps we are getting a little ahead of ourselves. There's no reason for us to have a conversation that's too deep right now. Please, forget I mentioned it. I tried to change the subject as cool as possible. Youve been rather quiet about what youre planning for the science fair. Are you willing to tell me a little bit about it?
She looked at me skeptically. Though it was both awkward and obvious how I was changing the subject, she eventually went along with it. Well, Im not going to tell you too much. However, I would like to go to some elaborate computer conventions in the U.S. My science project will be so complex Mr. Dalton wont be able to break down my data. She stretched as though she was getting tired.
Would you like me to take you home now? I asked her, but Sally leaned her head into me, snuggling.
Oh, no. I am having a great time. Sally slid her hands around me as we looked up at the stars. What do you like most about the stars?
Astrophysics I guess. Astrophysics is the study of the physical nature of stars. My dream is to someday visit Kitt Peak, Arizona, because it is equipped with a long, specially designed solar telescope. It is the worlds largest solar observatory. Sally was obviously no longer interested. Is something wrong? I questioned.
Oh, I just thought you would have a more romantic answer to my question. Sally dropped her gaze to the fire. Looking at her I felt a wave of sadness wash over her face.
I looked up at the stars again and pointed as I said, That one.
Sally noticed I was pointing up at the night sky when she lifted her eyes and asked, What are you talking about?
That one. I repeated, I have found a star which I would like to name after you. It is not the brightest one but it is easy to find because it is just above the center star of Orion's belt. It is the star of the present and it is now named after you. Tomorrow I will contact the aero space federation and make it official.
One of Sally's eyes welled up with a tear. Oh, I like that. I would like to name one after you.
Go ahead, choose one and I will tell you if it has been named yet. I told her.
Sally used the telescope and zeroed in on a specific star. She tried a few before we found one which had not yet been named.
The Eddy Evon star. She said with a great smile of contentment on her face.
There is one star out there which expresses how much my heart cares for you. Can you guess which one it is? I asked her profoundly.
Sally thought about it but she could not come up with the answer. I told her I would tell her in the morning.
Sally continued to try many times before she cleverly answered, The sun?
Yes, I answered, I care for you with a love that burns as big and bright as the sun.
Sally was very happy to hear this and cuddled right into my chest even further. We were so content in each other's company. Gently, I stroked my fingers through her hair.
Sally? I asked. If you don't mind me asking, what is it you want to do when you get out of school? my question was followed with a long silence. I mean, what kind of goals have you set for yourself and your future?
I haven't thought about it much. Ill cross that bridge when I get there, but I have always imagined myself home raising a family while my husband provided for us. I moved closer to her and she said, I don't want to be isolated forever. I have been isolated long enough.
I know what you mean. Do you feel isolated now? I asked.
No. She said. Do you?
Only my lips. I dared her. My lonely, isolated lips.
She gave me a teasing innocent smile, before she surprised me bending forward and pecking me on the lips. I was immediately taken. I leaned toward her to steel another one, but she didn't know what I was planning, so we ended up lightly bumping our heads together again. I thought she was hurt, until she began to laugh again. I was very relieved to see she was all right. I began to laugh along with her.  
Sally curled up, snuggling into my chest. We looked to the sky as she said. It sure is beautiful, the stars are crystal clear and I can see the surface of the bright blue full moon.
And you. I added. How did I ever win your love, this will always be a mystery to me. I hope I never awake if I am dreaming.
Sally spoke softly, Perhaps it is fate.

She didn't get home until three o'clock in the morning. She told me, a couple of days later, how she had been scolded by her parents. From our first date, Sally and I saw much more of each other. We had many dinner dates where the two of us would enjoy cooking and preparing, before we ate and cleaned up our mess together. I left her letters and sent her cards in some unexpected places which read about the things I liked most about her. Sometimes I sent her flowers with small notes which told her to have a fantastic day.
She played dress up once in a while, and she really went all out; pink dress, jewelry, make up, high heels, and stockings. We never went to any fancy places, but that didn't give her any reason not to show off how glamorous she could look.
I bought her special presents which were not always expensive and sometimes very simple, just to surprise her. We would also talk about some of our first memories. For instance, reminisce about the first time we saw each other or our first kiss. We shared some of the feelings which we were too nervous to tell each other at the time. I never told her about being abducted by Jay as a child or meeting aliens from another planet or the death of Hal. I also hid the facts how my mother was from the Ied era along with my project of working on an insect vehicle in the side of a mountain on the mainland. I didn't want her to be afraid of me. One thought which conflicted with my secretive agenda to return to my home world was if any of my efforts to go home were even worth it. The quest to return home was more my mothers than my own. If our attempt failed I could have a wonderful life here with Sally. I was tempted to throw in the towel on many occasions and tell Sally everything. Such temptations lacked a certain necessity.
When Sally and I would go for long trips in my car, we would take along a special book and take turns reading it to each other. We went everywhere together, old mine tunnels, boat rides, horseback riding or hiking. We found a quiet and secluded place at the shore where we would go swimming together in private.
Because of how large I was compared too little petite Sally, she would often climb all the way into my shirt and tickle torture me. I liked it when she would climb around and scratch that hard to get area on my back with her long finger nails. I also enjoyed how she would take time to examine me. Her fingers would dance over my skin and it tickled. She touched the raised metacarpals of my hand and rubbed the rippling bony plate of my fore-arm. She continued further to follow the curves of my muscles. She would let her fingers follow the lines of my tattoo. She liked the design of the eagle and planet. She said she would change the wording one day so it read Property of Sally. She kissed the raised scars of numbers which were branded into me. 2002 Oh, how I loved her.
If we were hiking in the woods or walking for a long distance, Sallys legs would get sore, so I would prop her up so she could sit on my shoulder plate.
I have learned how possibly the number one joyous desire everyone sought in the world was laughter. There was almost nothing which could make one feel so good, warm, alive, and happy to be with another person as a real good laugh. But I wanted more time with her. It would seem sometimes the job with Bigwheels was more trouble than it was worth. So I decided to quit my job with Bigwheels. My mother was furious with me, but she just didnt understand.
I was spending time with Sally at school, after school and in the evening. I loved every moment with her.

Gastonish seemed almost as obsessed with the health and well-fare of the new Zandith Crockmior life-boat as she was with her idea to rule the Island. She felt she could deliver an advanced system of law or a new order which would bring humans into a unity of agreement and lead them to peace and prosperity. Her experience with the laws of the Ied era and her knowledge with how she could provide something important to the twenty-second century compelled her to do all she could to rule. The officials of the Island were impressed with Gastonishs project. They decided to allow her to go forward as long as she shared all of her ideas with the Island officials and worked with them closely. If we were not on the secluded Island, such an idea would never go forward at all.

Chapter 10

Tension was high at school on the day of the science fair. Everyone was in competition with each other to be the best. I always knew I was different from humans but I learned to tolerate them. My biggest problem with humans was how they seemed to waist too much time on rest and relaxation. All I wanted to do was work and create and Gastonish assured me this was normal for volks. I did not want to feel I was a volk amongst primitives, but it seemed to be a common occurrence I kept to myself.
In every class you will find the over achievers, under achievers, class clowns and bullies, but the ones who you really have to look for are the quiet students. They are the ones who seem to slip through the system undetected. In my class there was one student who fit the bill. His name was Frank. I don't know if he had a last name. Sometimes I found the initial I after his name. I checked the class attendance and his homework signature. All I found was Frank was dyslexic. He tried to keep it a secret but kids always seem to figure these things out. Frank was often teased for it. 
I tried to talk to him one day. I asked why he was brought to the Island. He didn't know. I asked who his parents were, but he did not know the answer to that question either. He sincerely wanted to know the answers too and I was upsetting him by asking. He seemed like such a vulnerable child so I left him alone. He was a very quiet child and he made it clear how he preferred to be left alone.
As everyone presented their projects one by one at the science fair, I grew more excited for my turn to come. It was to be the moment where I shared my brilliance and again prove the superiority of a volk. 
Justin, a rugby player, displayed a miniature set of figures performing some kind of dark arts ritual and a twenty page written biography. 
While Kinta tried to present a strange view of Darwins theory of evolution. In his rendition, he collaborated many pictures together. These were pictures he had drawn by hand. It started with fish and sea creatures, which later moved to land creatures. As the pictures went on we saw fish to monkey to man then to volk. I was not happy with his project but it did make me wonder about the possibilities. At least it had the virtue of never being done before. 
Frank made a classic science fair volcano. He made a brief presentation and blew it up as it was designed to do. It grabbed your attention, but there was no way he would be able to win at the fair with it. 
Sally had a good idea of how competitive I was going to be so she put a great deal of work into her project. She booted up the class computer and ran a 3-D story from the monitor. She programmed the story from beginning to end. She added orchestrated music as the frame by frame scenes took the class through space. We visited stars, constellations and other worlds of her own creation. I was totally impressed and very proud of her. The worlds she had animated seemed totally possible to discover in the great mystery of space. The final shot was of an animated little green alien with three eyes saying, Zzz-zzz... Zzz-zzz... Thats all folks! Other projects were also interesting but nothing was as impressive as Sallys.
However, there was this one young girl who seemed very odd to me from the time she stepped off the boat. She was part of one of the last group of people who came to the Island, her name was Kiki Vixen and she dressed like a punk rocker. Her hair was jet black except for the green liberty spikes she had projecting from the left side of her head. She was relatively quiet and kept to herself, but she was very impressive as she illustrated yo-yo tricks. At first, it would seem there would be very little to see, but Kiki was actually so impressive how she not only controlled the yo-yos, she seemed to defy the laws of gravity with them as well. Kiki's display had posters which she drew, colored and hung up behind her, with a CD player on the floor beside her. Blasting a hard rock version of 'Man-eater', Kiki managed to pull it all off wonderfully.
When it came time for my presentation, Mr. Dalton introduced me. And finally we come to Mr. Eddy Evons project which he has titled, Mr. Dalton pushed his spectacle up his nose slightly and read my projects name from a list he attached to a clipboard, The Volkevon? Everyone gathered around a simple wooden table. At one end was a car battery attached to some wires leading to a switch. At the center of the table, was a shiny metal object which had the same size and shape of a football. This is an experiment which will defy the laws of gravity in place of its own gravitational field. Mr. Daltons eyes grew wide for a moment. He took Frank by the arm and moved him to the front of the row. Frank stood directly in front of me with the best view of my presentation. I did not wonder why at the time, I did not care, all I wanted to do was to win the science fair.
When I had everyones attention, I made my announcement. I will attempt to create a new means of flight. The students were not very interested, but I had faith that would all change very soon. I was going to try something with a liquid methane jet propulsion, but Mr. Dalton convinced me to carry out this project to the end. Still the other students seemed bored. Pushing on, I began my presentation. Using electromagnetic energy, a pendulum will swing and swing for a very long time. Gravity alone just wont do it. But a top, with the proper weight, will spin for a very long time, thanks to gravity. With magnets it can spin for what seems to be an eternity. The earth spins retaining its gravity within our solar system. As well, the moon will continue its rotation around the earth. Why? Because everything of matter is affected by gravity. Well, almost everything.
What I have designed here is a gravimetric field, but I have given it the name, Volkevon field. I reached down and pulled another shiny metal football shaped object from a cardboard box. The other object was cut in vivisections to show what the inside of the Volkevon looked like. I pointed to the inner parts as I continued. The core of this object you see here is the central power source. It is called element 115 but for arguments sake we will just call it a bar magnet. At this tip is the north head and the opposite tip is the south head. This energy source acts as a particle accelerator. The center core is this round glass marble looking part that each of the magnetic heads run into. It will get very hot. Around the center core of the magnet is a carefully designed coil reflector with a radioactive center implant. This radioactive implant has microwave cross beams. At the moment, the gravimetric field is running so low from the magnetic core it is less harmful to you than a cellular phone. It was the magnet which is supplying its energies right now. The particle accelerator can become very unstable at high energy outflows, but element 115 is an Island of stability. The only other time such an element can be stable is at element 247, as far as I can tell.
From this charged center, a radiation of antimatter is created. When I add antimatter with matter it produces 100% heat energy. This needs to be converted into electrical energy, so I needed to make a thermal electric converter. As you can see from this model, there are no wires running throughout this devise and when I start it up you will find there will be no exhaust either.
From the huge discharge of stable electrical energy, three small gravity projectors can articulate their angles by the control of this remote. I pulled out a hand held remote controller. Radio waves and other forms of frequencies are distorted when they are near this device so it was very difficult for me to find the proper remote device for this particular project. But before I show you this device in action I just want to explain a little further. 
This Volkevon produces four forms of force which are; 1. Vibrational force, used to controlled frequencies between the relationship of matter and energy. 2. Nuclear force. 3. Gravitational force, and 4. The force of repulsion.
With my acute calibration of pulling and pushing forces, the Volkevon creates a field reality, if you will. A new realm or distortion. I put the half-cut model back into its box.
I touched the two ends of the jumper cords together quickly. There was no spark, so I knew for certain the switch was off. I clamped the two ends of the jumper cords onto each end of the Volkevon. Positive to the north head and negative to the south head. I flipped the switch to on. The Volkevon grew a haze around it like a glowing aura. Energy ran over the silvery metal hull like thin waves of gentle fire.
I dont like this at all, Eddy. Spoke Mr. Dalton sternly. Youve mentioned nuclear energy. I had no idea you were dealing with this much power in the classroom. Turn it off! The Volkevon bobbed and dipped as it rose off the table top.
I cannot just shut it off, Mr. Dalton. All of the elements must harmonize or else we run the risk of instability. Mr. Dalton remained silent and stared at the Volkevon as though he was in a trance. Now, when I increase the power from the battery with this switch, the center core will charge up with energy and begin to get hot. I need to purge the system as it charges the magnetic current. It will grow stronger and the field will develop and grow larger. The outer surface of the field is like an atmosphere, if you will, and under this atmospheric field a new realm will be born. This realm will have its own gravity, drawing everything into the center toward the central core, however the central core is protected by the shiny metal hull of the Volkevon. This object will be free from our earths gravity and it will float around like it is immune to our worlds gravitational influence. From a view point of using quantum mechanics, two matter particles are seen as being carried by a graviton. Within an electro-magnetic field, electrically charged particles interact. These particles include electrons and quarks but gravitrons are uncharged particles and don't interact with electro-magnetic fields. The gravitrons are important because they make up gravitational waves but unfortunately they are very weak. Part of my challenge during this project was to make them strong.
Okay, it looks like it is ready! Now stand back, this will not move fast, but if someone hits it, it will move fast and you won't like the feeling of being tugged by two gravities, not to mention the radio waves and microwaves would not be too healthy either. I started to pull the switch slowly as it powered up.
Just as a caution for you all, I raised my hand and put my finger in the air to catch everyones attention. You may lose sight of the object all together, but you should be able to follow the distortion of its shape. Do not be alarmed, it will just be bending light around its new field reality.
I eased the switch over slightly allowing more energy to serge into the core. I released the cable clamps from the north and south poles of the Volkevon. The Volkevon was silent as it began to rise off the table. An oval shaped distortion had been formed around it like the heat waves of a newly paved road. The distortion you see is the field reality. You can almost see the direction of the current as it follows the invisible magnetic sphere shaped flow. Pushing out at the north and south traveling across the atmosphere to the center where it is pulled back in. I eased the small levers of the remote controller. And the Volkevon began to lift higher from the table by a force all its own. Using an omicron configuration and a deltacrom configuration of the gravity projectors, I am now controlling the movements of the devise. It rose slowly, with a low crackly hum of a corona discharge, a by-product of the high voltage. Otherwise it was soundless. Notice when the Volkevon moves, it will tilt slightly in the direction it means to travel. This is because it is creating a slight distortion in the direction I want it to go. This distortion is a gravity wave, or a phase shift wave. This gravity wave acts as a gravitational slope, so essentially it is like the devise is moving downhill, but it is merely an illusion. I have designed for the craft to move in the direction of this illusion which I was only able to create through the field reality. This is how I can control the direction of the Volkevon. The view of the Volkevon began to waver as its image seemed to faze out of existence. Moving the levers, I tried to keep the distortions from bending light causing the devise to ultimately disappear, but it was of no use. The Volkevon eventually cloaked from sight entirely. Everyone gasped when they lost sight of it.
Mr. Dalton said. I don't like this. Eddy, bring it back. For the rest of you? Line up at the main door. Consider this a fire drill.
I can't bring it back, sir. The Volkevon is not that sophisticated. I have to let the charge wear off first before it will come down on its own. I explained.
Eddy, youre in big trouble. He turned to address the class. Everyone out! Before the students even opened the main door, a student raised his hand to ask a question and unknowingly tapped the invisible Volkevon. A disturbance in the projects atmospheric reality exposed the Volkevon with waves of distortion. Everyone saw the project begin to move before it disappeared from sight again. Confusion led to panic amongst my peers.
Where is it now? A young voice asked with a slight quiver of fear behind it. The students started running for the door in a mad rush. I did not realize my science project would end up so troublesome. Fear came from everyone's lack of understanding, but I did not find the Volkevon dangerous at all.
Outside, Mr. Dalton seemed a little steamed to say the least. Hey, listen up everybody. Mr. Dalton called to the students. We have to work on our fire drill organization.
I remained in the classroom after convincing Mr. Dalton the Volkevon was truly harmless. The teacher and all of the students watched from outside the classroom window. They were very quiet and I'm sure the students noses were no more than an inch from the window looking in. I pointed and said, There it is!
Outside, the students breathed relief. The Volkevon was right where I thought it would be, Hovering next to the ceiling in the corner of the class room. As I pulled the Volkevon down from the ceiling corner, I said. I hope, just because you had to evacuate the classroom, you wont let this little incident affect my grades. I let go of the Volkevon carefully above the table and it just hovered weightlessly in the air.

The top of the Islands peak kept helicopters, cannons, radars and various technical instruments from weather to observation. Level by level, we discovered the entire inner structure of the Island was self sufficient. The exterior of the Island, we knew, was just the tip of the iceberg. The inside of the Island extended far below the oceans surface.
Studying the computerized map of the Island, we found each room was numbered. By using the mouse and double clicking on any given number on the map, a screen would appear providing us access to the areas surveillance cameras. We could access several video surveillance view points from both inside and outside the Island. The system also had audio capabilities. There were fifty eight thousand nine hundred and eighty two cameras throughout the entire Island. There were some small simple private quarters for the staff, recreational swim and fitness gym, bio chemical labs, blood labs, DNA research and testing labs. The center of the Island had a huge solid cylindrical core which passed through many levels. Its number corresponded with the letters T.S. Core storage facilities. Below the core facility was the main power generator. At the outskirts of the generator was the lower military bunker and hardware hanger. Multiple security sectors were located at random locations all over the Islands grid, and similar hidden passageways were also found but not all of them led out to a road. Some led out to surface facilities like the doctors office, peoples homes and even the schoolhouse. 
Schoolhouse? I looked around the room in wonderment. Recalling the time I spent in that school room I never suspected a hidden passage was possible. It surprised me with a boyhood sense of wonderment.
I told Sally to burn everything onto a disk and keep quiet while I searched for the hidden passage. I concentrated and focused all of my senses on the surroundings to find a sign which would directly or indirectly lead me to the hidden door. I knocked on the chalk board, stomped my feet on the floor and looked behind every wall. When I came up empty handed, I moved to search the only other likely place where the passage way could possibly be.
After Sally burned the files onto a disk, I rolled up my sleeve off the romstrunn and opened it. I placed the disk inside the romstrunn. I felt it was secure there when I heard the cover snap shut.
I took Sally outside to the cellar doors at the back of the school. I reached down and pulled the floor doors open. The pad lock and chain did not put up much resistance, they easily snapped off. I led her down the stairs, into the dark. Besides a boiler unit near to the far wall, I was surprised to find so much empty space. I can't see a thing. Sally whispered as we both had to duck low because of the wiring, water piping and venting.
Its probably just as well. A voice spoke. What do you think you are doing in here anyway? It was Mr. Dalton. I was so certain Sally and I were alone just a moment before he spoke, and my eyes are pretty good in the dark. Nevertheless, Mr. Dalton was in the school cellar. I didn't want to argue with him or ask permission to search for the hidden passage. Sally still strained her eyes to find the teacher but I could see more than just Mr. Daltons silhouette. I stepped toward him, raised my hand to his face and flicked him in the fore-head with my finger. He was out cold before he hit the floor. A glance to my left revealed a bench of tools and old dusty parts and junk. To my right was a large metal door with a tiny blinking red light above it. A security computer card-lock panel was mounted to the wall beside the large door. I found a light bulb hanging from the ceiling with a small dangling chain. I pulled the chain and the basement lit up with a soft orange glow.
Sally studied the room quickly once the darkness was defeated. Oh my! What have you done to Mr. Dalton? Sally went to the school teacher where she checked to make sure he was breathing and to be sure he still had a pulse.
How is he? It was then I began to wonder if Mr. Dalton was seriously injured.
Hes okay, but what did you do to him?
I knocked him out. With relief I told Sally what I did.
Sally glared at me. Hes a good man. Don't hurt anyone else or I will scrap this whole thing and turn you in myself.
We are in a desperate situation. I am not going to be caught and you will be protected under my care. Just follow my instructions and you wont have to worry about anything. When I spoke to Sally this way, she seemed to tense up. Now she was worried.
Well, maybe we should scrap this whole idea anyway. Being thrown into a high security prison isnt what I want. It could easily happen to me, but a volk? What would they do to you? Arent you worried they will lobotomize an uncooperative volk?
What are you saying? You want me to do nothing? I cant do that. When we get inside this door more secrets will be open to us? You are with me, aren't you?
What good will it do you to know the secrets of this Island or any other Island if it's just going to get you killed? You and I would be better off not going any further and enjoy our time here than to risk everything, besides not even you could get through that door, Eddy. Sally had attitude. Unless you can surprise me and produce a pass code card with a magnetic strip from your deck of trick cards.
No, I don't need to produce a pass-code card, Mr. Dalton should already be carrying one. Come on, let's search him.
Sally stood with her hand on her hip and gave me a coy stare. She was putting up a fair share of resistance. I began to bend down to search Mr. Dalton myself when Sally quickly bent down before me and frantically searched the pockets of the school teacher. In no time, Sally found the card in the wallet of the teacher's inside jacket pocket. She slipped the card into her own pocket and ran up the stairs out of the cellar. I am sorry Eddy, but I can't let you do this. Sally shouted back at me as she bolted.
I heard a lot of noise growing outside. I ran out behind Sally and saw a massive military force approaching from down the road. My mother once told me the bees will get mad if you shake their hive. They were kicking up a huge cloud of dust behind them. Five AH-64 Apache helicopters were in the air. A Mi-17 helicopter landed between Sally and the oncoming MK. VII Churchill Crocodile tanks, armored personnel carriers, surface-to-surface missile (SSM) trucks and military jeeps. 
Sally climbed aboard the Mi-17 helicopter and it lifted off.

As out of place as it may have seemed for the moment, all I could think about was how one way or another I was seeing the Knolix Island for the last time. What I had the most trouble with leaving behind was not just my home but a world I had literally helped to build with my own two hands. 
Behind me was the new extension to school which I was a large part of. And the bridge made of logs which the military was crossing with confidence their heavy tanks would be supported. I recalled the new swimming pool and water slides and a one of a kind human water launcher powered from a pulse generator, all of my design. Near to this was the games court and golf course so no one had to suffer of boredom who lived on the Knolix Island. The labs and observatories I wanted to visit in the world were recreated to the finest detail possible from the information I could scrounge up as a gift to Sally. I built training courses with specialized performance military programs I created to enhance the military soldiers who came to the Island. 
I thought about the town of Scamp where Gastonish and I did more than this as we organized a functioning business circuit on the Island by talking to the people to find their strengths. We persuaded people to try our ideas with positivity and encouragement. Gastonish and I loved to work together as we assisted the people to make their dreams come true. We became financially tied to everything the people of Scamp did. Through persuasion and reverse psychology, we managed to affect positive change so the people had reason to believe it was by their own intellect and efforts where they created such successes and strengths to the town of Scamp with a reward program. It was by these same means Gastonish had the people conceive of electing a town mayor. Gastonish and I were nominated as a couple of prime candidates.

Chapter 11

Gastonish was working with blue prints in a spacious mahogany office. Everything in the office was set neatly and precisely in its place from books displayed on shelves to the sheets of paper shredded and laid neatly in the waste basket. He stood just behind Gastonish's left shoulder like he was her bodyguard or something.

Always experimenting with different wigs, her beauty had been one where getting used to it was common.

Our responsibility must be as constant as the stability we expect from the atmosphere which surrounds our planet and gives us life. A force behind the workforce like a booster in our society which finds a usefulness for people from a standby list. Everyone unemployed must be on the list. Crime doesnt pay? A stocky built Russian ambassador said. Dont you think most people have figured that out?

Governments and kingdoms rise and they fall. Populations grow and millions will die due to war, disease or famine. Life in this world has its own form of control and we call it nature. I flew from the car and in a matter of a few short leaps I checked the computer screen to see what he found so important.
At least I didn't have to worry about the hard part in finding and using a high security computer to gain access. The agent was seconds from down-loading something important and closing the file. The computer beeped and the information was saved onto a memory disk. I popped out the disk and slid it into my romstrunn. Dr. Evon ran to my side and looked over my shoulder.
These are restricted files. You should not be looking at this! Dr. Evon seemed to panic as though I might stumble onto something important. He obviously wanted to keep his secrets, a secret but this was a time for confessions and I was determined to see to it.
Dr. Evon quickly tried to reach around me and touch the keyboard. I pushed his face away with the palm of my hand. Eddy, Please! You are in over your head. Now surrender before you get us all killed. I made no effort to entertain his request. You should, at least check the map icon to figure out where you are.
I already know where I am. This is not the first time I have accessed this computer network. As the words flowed from my mouth, Dr. Evon went as pale as a ghost. He jolted toward the power cord and I pulled him away at the instant his fingertips made contact. Spinning from the desk chair, I held Dr. Evon by his arms and kept his elbows tight together at his back. Dr. Evon struggled for a moment and before he relaxed in my powerful hold.
Tossing Dr. Evon away from me like a useless bag of trash, I made my point. I continued searching the open file. I found documentations of each and every citizen of the Island. I scanned over the names and double clicked over the name Frank Emsesqua. His file appeared on the screen and I heard a slight gasp from Dr. Evon.
What are you doing Eddy, is this what all of this is for? To read private files? I don't believe you ever really knew or wanted to know, Frank. I thought you were going to break into some important files. Dr. Evon rested his head back slightly with a smug smile directed at me.
Don't be so obvious Doctor. The sound of your rapid heart rate is so annoying it becomes more distracting than you are. I have struck a nerve here and you know it. Now, lets see what secrets are so important to you. I moved the cursor down the file and read everything. 
Frank was the quiet boy who sat at the back of my school-room class. He seemed to struggle with many simple class assignments. Frank was the kind of kid which didn't seem to invite the other peers to want to get to know him. I often wondered, was he somehow more than the teased dyslexic of my class? What brought him to this Island? Could he be so dangerous he should be separated from society?
Now the truth was pouring out to me from the file as I read. At first it was as refreshing as water but it soon began to burn to an uncomfortable torment. Frank was one of the Knolix Island's experiments in cloning. Apparently, the Island was heavily involved in cloning procedures. I learned how a clone was a group of organisms derived from a single individual by various types of asexual reproduction. A method was used to lead DNA to RNA. They also used the process of Mitosis by which a cell is divided to produce two identical cells. A cell is the structural unit of plant or animal life. These cells that differ from the parent cell only by size are considered Mitotic. 

Frank was cloned with the DNA of Albert Einstein. He was the product of one of the world's greatest minds. The file mockingly referred to him as Frank Einstein. The Government's own top secret creation for the purpose of studying and stretching the boundaries of a human mind. He was created in another secluded laboratory in California. After experiencing problems unlocking his minds potential, they soon moved him to the Island where they hoped my influence would bring out the genius within him.
My file was the longest and most elaborate. Lucky for us, I could read it all at a glance. I was shocked to discover all of the skin, blood and tissue samples, along with countless experiments which were conducted on me, went toward a twisted idea to create computer programmable volk clones of myself for military purposes. Initially, I wanted to destroy the Knolix Island right then and there. As I read on, I found many of the samples of my body were used in experiments to find what effects volk blood and other fluid samples of my body would have in a human bodys system. I wanted to know who it was who received such treatment, but my file only referred to the patient as factor: 26759.
I turned and grabbed Dr. Evon by the breast of his shirt. Who is the one given injections of my blood? What were the effects? I stood up from the chair and lifted Dr. Evon off his feet. Give me the name! I ordered him as I drew back my fist. You better answer me! The doctors eyes welled up and his face became red and tight as he quivered with fear.
Eddy, stop! Gastonish spoke from the open car door. With her hand pressed against her chest, Gastonish was recovering quickly or else she was putting on one amazing show. Her tone made me feel like I was a two year old again. This isn't like you to be so impatient. Besides, look at him. I don't think he could answer you even if you asked him to give you his own name.
Dr. Evon went limp with fatigue. I knew I could not depend on him so I had to find a different way to track the name. I exited my file and scrolled down the names from the list of the Island population. Beside each name was a number. I found the number: 26759 and beside it was the name Domin. I opened the file. Domin was also one of the Islands experiments. He was not a clone, but one would wonder if they had been successful in re-birthing the devils rage within him. As a newborn, Domin came into the world physically handicap as his body had deficiencies. He was not expected to live for very long. Domin was selected in breach of project operations because only those were selected who were in prime physical health. The mistake was made within the operation of absolute secrecy and justified as Domin proved to be the most resilient human subject. The project involved volk body parts to be implanted into human bodies. Four other newborns were also selected. They were named; Narl, Stroy, Oblit, and Grud. 'Who were they?' I wondered as I had never met these fascinating and mysterious Brothers. Eddy felt a kinship with these Brothers though he was cheated in never being permitted the opportunity to meet them. 
Organs were replaced and repaired in all of the Brothers but Domin was the only one to ultimately survive the operations. The other four had been driven mad with anger to the point of death. Only Domin seemed to defy the odds time and time again. 
'Domin was a real survivor. I had no idea what he had been through.' The volk organ donor was none other than my twin brother who died at birth. Though I had grown up with Domin, I never suspected he and I had so much in common despite his amazing abilities. At school he had his moments where he seemed uncontrollable. His anger and solitude left him very unpopular. According to the report, the injections had an affect on his mind, strength and metabolism. CAT scans revealed his mind was, both rejecting and accepting the volk flesh. The result; Domin's human body parts had to work harder than they were designed. With his extraordinary disorder, Domin was unwillfully driven to anger. His body grew in musculature as though he was on steroids. I personally found Domin's strength rivalled my own. 'Knowing what I know now, I would have had better relations with Domin and been more patient with him and his struggles with his anger and power. When Domin went missing from the Island, many people hoped it was for good. Perhaps he did not leave the Island, maybe he was taken within it. I might find him here imprisoned someplace.'

I was just about to leave the computer console when another name seemed to stand out in the list; Doctor William J. Evon.
Glancing over at Dr. Evon, I didn't want to let him know I found a file on him. He was checking on Gastonish's wounds. No matter how long his file would end up being, all I needed was to glance at it to read it all. 
What was stranger than Dr. Evon having a file, was the content of the file. As a boy, Will Evon became entangled in an incident involving an alien encounter of his hometown. The creature used him to communicate through before it was shot and killed. The telepathic experience he had with the alien seemed to unlock and open Will Evon's mind. Academically he excelled and finally graduated at the top of many difficult fields at a prestigious university. Before Gastonish and I came along, Dr. Evon was the overseer of a captured alien Ornock. It to was killed trying to escape a heavily fortified government facility. The incident of the Ornock's death happened shortly after Gastonish was burned and captured.

A female voice spoke loud and strong through the intercom. Intruder alert on level four. The tech lab is being raided by the factor: Eddy. All military personnel must use extreme caution. Shoot to kill.
Dr. Evons jaw dropped and my mother began to rush me to get moving. Another voice, a male voice spoke out over the intercom which was strong, experienced and secure. Dispatch, this is Commander Hinton, please verify the location of the intruders.
Level four, Tech lab. I am looking at them on the monitor right now! To no avail, the feminine speaker tried to cover the nervousness in her voice.
Confirmed dispatch, we are on route. A break of static ended the transmission.
All right, thats it. I said. We're outa here. I was content knowing the memory disk loaded with information was safely tucked away in my romstrunn.
The loud speaker buzzed to life again. Commander, out-post has ordered you to keep the volk factor from entering C-section. C-section must be kept quarantined at all costs.
A nervous voice spoke low and shakily from behind me. If you knew what kind of man commander Hinton was you would be running for your life right now. Dr. Evon warned.
Jumping back into the car, I gazed across the tech lab at some double doors of another elevator. I thought about attempting to enter them but the panel on the wall was designed for voice code authorization only, and none of the other technicians seemed to know how to use it because they all steered clear of it. I threw the car into a tight U-turn, knocking over tables and lab equipment, before we headed back to the elevator at the other end of the Swiss cheese hallway. 
The doors slid open and the elevator took us to the next lower level. The doors opened to a parking lot of small vehicles, as well as a set of battery powered street bikes. We breezed past the parked vehicles before we headed into the corridor which led us through a maze of turns. When we came to a large sealed door, I told Dr. Evon, Get out and open the door. 
Reluctantly, Dr. Evon stood out of the car and opened the large door. When the door split and slid into the walls, we were faced with a blur of traffic streaming by. I got out of the car and told Dr. Evon to get back into it. Peeking around the corner, I looked for a large gap between the traffic of tiny cars. When I saw it, I jumped back into the driver's seat and gunned it across the four lanes of traffic to another set of double doors on the other side. Ramming the doors in, we continued through the corridors as they quickly lost their formal, clean, appeal as though we were moving deeper into the mechanical guts which made the Knolix Island run. The walls of the dark, dimly lit corridor were built up of a variety of large pipes and black twisted shafts along with thick electrical cables. One short section was congested with a large complex circuitry net-work which opened up to a room. Island technicians and workers scrambled to get out of our way. We conveyed the appearance of terrorizing invaders but I felt like we were renegades running from the law. Curious as we were, we had no time to search anything. As we made our way through the dark maze of warning lights and hissing coolant pipes, we heard a distant but heavy hum. The hum grew as we approached it. It was not long before my suspicions were correct, we came to the Islands central generator. 
The area around the generator was dark, hot and loud. Most of the hydro equipment was made of metal and anchored or built into the volcanic rock of the Island. Ahead of us was a deep gorge with human architecture throughout multiple scaffoldings built over and amongst the exposed solid rock. I brought the car to a stop at a fenced off edge where we could see down many other levels. The gorge was obviously deeper than sea level and evidence of coral was proof how at one time it was all under the sea. Water droplets fell at random from above. Thin waterfalls cascaded down the steep rocky walls. We needed to get to the other side of the gorge and the only way down was to cross a long narrow metal bridge. The bridge was too narrow for my car. I stepped out of the car and walked a short distance onto the bridge. I held the railings gripping a hand on each one. I leaned forward slightly and bent the metal railings outward.
Gun shots stung the metal rods around me and the roof and hood of my car. Dr. Evon panicked with wide eyes as the sparks of bullet heads sprung up around us. A few brave agents took it upon themselves to deal with us rather than waiting for the soldiers to arrive.
I ducked back into the car and drove us over the railing of the narrow metal bridge. As we crept over the deep gorge, the rails creaked and bent further outwards. Cables snapped at random under the car's overload weight and shot off above us. Metal squealed all the more, before there came a great snap of bolt heads sheering off at the joints. Unstable, the entire support structure jolted downward. I gunned the car forward and just as the entire bridge was disconnecting at both ends, we jumped the car off the severed bridge and fell into the gorge. 
We were all surprised to have landed harshly onto a wide scaffolding at sub-level thirteen, ten stories below. A moment was lost as we collected ourselves. My compact car drove off the scaffolding and entered a new corridor where many more soldiers were taken by surprise. A command was given and they opened fire. I throttled forward through the mob of soldiers. We kept our heads low in the car as bullets shattered glass and shot dangerously close to our heads. The thick metal design of the car protected us, but the soldiers outside found the more they shot the more their bullets were ricocheting back at them. The onslaught of bullets was brief and ended abruptly. The corridor led us to a spacious warehouse facility where military vehicles and loading equipment large and small were kept. We rolled out to the center of the warehouse and took a breath in awe. 
We were out of the frying pan and into the fire.

An eerie silence filled the spacious warehouse as the soldiers surrounded us with their automatic weapons. Freeze!!! Came the shout from the soldier in charge. I looked up and found other soldiers running along the narrow metal catwalk which was suspended midway up the walls and surrounded the entire perimeter. Lieutenant Vincent W. Abernathy, sir. I have assumed control of the situation. Lieutenant Vincent W. Abernathy was a tall young soldier who was dressed in grey camouflage fatigues. The lieutenant in charge didn't tell us to get out of the vehicle. It didn't seem as though he had any plans to deal with us if we were to become uncooperative. I was betting he would loyally and narrow-mindedly follow his orders to just hold us.
My mother, sitting beside me, bumped my knee. I turned my head slowly in her direction. She had my pack sack between her legs. The pack sack was filled with the artifacts of the Ied era. Doctor. I called. Dr. Evon lifted his head and looked at me through the reflection of the rear view mirror. His eyes were tired but still quivered with fear. Or else, I will try a more risky form of escape which will likely get us killed considering the ammunition pointed at us.

Thats better. Do it, now! I urged him.
Dr. Evon put his hand out the broken rear window and said. Please, don't shoot me. I am Dr. Evon, primary military specialty; medic and chief of operations for the Knolix project. I have been taken hostage by these escapees. They will kill me if you do not accept the terms of their proposal.

Where are you taking us? asked Dr. Evon.
I'm not sure. This was not on the map. I presume it will lead us to some other undersea establishment or possibly a submarine access. I told him.
After twenty minutes traveling through the tunnel, we were all beginning to feel the anxiety of getting to our destination. Where ever that might be. My grip of the steering wheel did not slacken. My indomitable arms, shoulders and upper chest remained brawny and frozen in vigorous concentration and control. How bad?

No! I can't accept that. I believe there is a solution to every problem.

Use... the two hickoops... Attach one... to the front end and... one to the back end... We will tell our sertz... to merge the hickoop current... She coughed. The double sized hickoop... will encase your entire car with us in it and... you will navigate it from within.

Control? I have confirmation. Firing torpedoes.

An explosion of fire and water broke the thick metal housing of the corridor. The combination of deep sea water pressure exchanging with a small space of air pressure was a fierce force. Thunderously, the ocean pushed its way in, within a mere second or two. The explosion was loud and like-wise, the sound of the sea flooding in was like the roar and pounding of a great beast. Just before Evon re-entered the hickoop, the double sized energy bubble lit up like a light bulb. The energy bubble hissed and burned at the behemoth of sea water. My six wheeled car was lifted off the floor as the sea muscled in on us. We were pushed about, tumbling like an ice cube stirred in a drink. However, within the hickoop Dr. Evon cowered with his body tightened and curled up. His eyes squeezed shut as the sound of water rushing in thundered around him. We were protected.
Most of the hickoops energy capsule, which surrounded us, was purple except for the pink area directly behind us and the blue area directly in front of us.

We were able to move through the water swiftly. Turning us around I headed out through the large red hot rimmed breach of the corridor. I took us up quickly, before the submarine could get a lock and fire at us again. The cars hickoop energy capsule bubbled and hissed its way right out from the oceans surface and into the air.

Keeping our flight above the clouds, because they offered the perfect cover, I turned off the hickoop bubble of energy and let the car free fall. The wind blew the steam away instantly. From about two thousand feet above sea level, I glanced around to see any air crafts but noticed no hostile activity.
