Often I would distract the giant cloned volk so Grizz could remain safely behind it and do the most effective damage.
Together, Grizz and I fought the first wave of cloned volk soldiers which were all trained and decorated military soldiers. The only other clones of myself who showed up to fight were younger versions of me and much less skilled.
The giant cloned volk seemed to realize it was not going to win against us as it tried to smash at us with a greater sense of urgency. The cloned volk tried to swing it's whip around at Grizz, but Grizz jumped over it like he was just playing a game.
Along with the younger cloned versions of myself were three young volk girls who surprisingly showed up. Neither Grizz nor myself could recognize them at first glance with mind control devices on their heads. The volk girls ranged in ages of ten, twelve and fourteen. These little volk women were dangerous killers. I quickly discovered the obvious as the girl clones were cloned from my mother.
Only my mother was never known to have such skill. These three cloned volk girls worked together as a single unit, spinning from one another as they performed their attacks.
Grizz took one look at the three little cloned volk girls and went pale, Don't go near them, Ed-man. I don't like the look of these girls.
At first I thought Grizz may have met the volk girls somewhere in the past, but I realized, he just didn't like little girls. For whatever reason, Grizz was scared of them.
Grizz and I were exhausted and the three little volk sisters were new and fresh on the scene, ready to start the fight. The little women wanted to put their training to the test, but Grizz and I couldn't be bothered to waste any more time. After I retrieved my axe, Grizz set off another one of his smoke bombs and we both disappeared and escaped the crazy machine shop from hell.

Passing through one security door after the other, moving deeper and deeper into the Island through computer facilities, and sealed vaults, we found they contained artifacts and information hidden from the world. 
We came to a door which led to a large circular loading dock. Beside the door was a number key pad which secured the massive door. I tried the same code I used to gain access to the computers Knolix system; 8462-TS. The code was accepted. I realized we made it. It occurred to me the numbers of the security code were for the key pad security, and the TS stood for Top Secret. There were seven vaults all together which encircled a loading dock. I began opening the doors and examining what was held inside. Grizz went as far as to drag artifacts out to the middle of the lift. He broke open crates and smashed priceless historical objects. Some objects were solid gold, like jewelry or statues salvaged from tombs across the globe. Some vaults stored crates which were well sealed. I was as desperate as Grizz to learn every last secret of the Knolix Island. I joined Grizz in his efforts to scour through the vaults. I grabbed crates and tore them open, throwing the product out onto the lift. Grizz and I opened some of the crates and found old artifacts and often religious artifacts. I was not interested in any of the items we were finding in the vaults. I mainly wanted to find cloning equipment and the facility used for growing and cultivating the clones. The first level was clean. 
The floor of the loading dock lowered us, one level, to a new set of seven huge vault doors. Below the floor were more levels which could descend for miles. The loading dock had the capability to hold countless items in deeper levels of the facility. The next level was a great generator attached to broilers with pipes and millions of thick electrical wires coming out from it. Two huge pipes ran into the monster generator. Each of these pipes contained gravity fed sea water to turn the massive turbines. The pipes were large enough to drive semi-trucks through them. The amount of power the generator could supply was enough to light Metro city. 
Each of the lower levels contained all sorts of items in warehouse size compartments. One level was of the Occult and black magic, another was of rare artifacts collected from the Christian religion. Another was of government secrets dating back decades. Egyptian wealth filled three levels of vaults. 'The government was the greatest tomb robber.' Near the bottom was where alien artifacts were stored. Frozen Ornocks were preserved in pods and a giant dead vorogon was also held there, but it was not my concern.
Grizz and I continued even lower to the last level. We waited patiently to reach the next level, listening to the sound of powerful unseen gears moaning and squeaking to take us further into the depths of the Knolix Island. The floor stopped with a clunk as though we hit bottom. Before us was a single gigantic door. The panel beside it seemed more complicated than the others, and it required a security card. I approached it knowing I probably would not be able to open it. Every step I took echoed through the deep empty space above us. I looked up at the empty distance throughout the lift cylinder. All of the doors we had opened were left open. I approached the door.
Before I reached the panel, a loud bang of heavy metal startled me. The accentuating sound echoing off the walls was also echoing within my chest. When I realized it was the massive dead bolts of the door releasing, I felt more at ease. A motor began to wine as the door started to lift.
I shot a glance at Grizz. The door is being opened from the other side. I told him.
Its those blasted cyborg volks! Grizz hesitated.
Quickly, I urged him. Find some cover. somersaulting, I flipped myself backwards and crouched down behind an Egyptian statue of a man with a dogs head. Grizz hid within a big bulky wooden crate. When the door opened entirely, Grizz and I peeked from our concealment and sure enough, a fresh squad of six cloned volk soldiers stood ready for battle. These were the youngest cloned volk soldiers who looked like me yet. The short cloned volks drew near to the lift. The soles of their boots were heard striking the floor in unison as though they were made of heavy paladin metal. Their ominous chanting march approached with perfect uniformity like a mighty locomotive. Stepping onto the lift, they examined the messy clutter of artifacts spread out all over the area. A few of the young volk soldiers stood dangerously close to Grizz using the barrel of its huge rifle to nose through the mess. Grizz cautiously slid into a long crate to keep the soldiers from looking down on him.
The entire squad of six, packed onto the lift platform. The head of my axe was dangling down by my ankles. I lifted it and held it in front of my chest. The cloned soldier was another mirror image of my younger self. The massive door buzzed and powerful motors began to slide it down slowly. The suspicious cloned soldier finally turned away from snooping any closer to me.
One of the soldiers seemed to stop and stare at the wooden crate Grizz was hiding in. A red light began to flash on the cloned soldiers mechanical head attachment. It was as though they were communicating with their squad leader or central computer mainframe. Next, I heard them flip a switch on their weapons which initiated a tone.
The surrounding cloned soldiers looked down at the crate in puzzlement. Grizz punched his fist through the top of the crate and took hold of the barrel of the cloned volks rifle. Standing up, Grizz busted out of the crate entirely. Pointing the rifle off to the side with his right hand, Grizz followed through driving his left fist against the clone volks jaw. Grizz continued to turn his body with the momentum of his punch bringing his left hand down to snatch the rifle out from the volk soldiers grip. While Grizz performed this move, the rifle was firing rocket shells against the wall. When he had successfully worked the weapon out of the volks grip he turned the devastating rocket shell ammo on the four other cloned soldiers. I immediately rose up, surprising the young clone who almost found me. I over took him, slapping his head between my hands, I damaged the device on the side of the clones head. Grizz lifted his rifle cocking it, before he shot the other four volks dead.
Time was running out. I grabbed my axe and headed for the door. The thick metal door was three quarters of the way down. From there we rolled out from under the tight gap of the door. The heavy door sealed up with a hiss of pressurized air before the locking dead bolts engaged. We could hear the motors of the lift working to take the lift up to some other level.
The spooky dark hall led us out to a terrace which over looked a huge warehouse-like area. Grizz and I crept as quietly as we could to the edge of the terrace. We hid behind some large blue barrels and inconspicuously spied on the practice taking place below. There, we found the walls aligned in ten levels, one above the other. Each level was sectioned with rows of egg shaped pods made of emerald titanium glass. Linked together, filling the vast underground complex with countless isles of pods, each grouping within the levels were at different stages of development. Their purpose was to incubate clones of myself, for military power. The aligned pods reminded me of giant insect eggs. Thousands, upon thousands of pods everywhere I looked but only half of them contained clones. The other pods were opened and empty. A computer could confirm how many clones were hunting for Grizz and I.
On the floor, at the center, we saw a maze of rooms and facilities. Their purpose was to cultivate and nurture the clones. I saw so many volk clones in the area, and they all looked like me and they were all at different ages of my life. They lived together and were kept fed and cleaned through the control of mind manipulation. The humans had a surgical area where they studied and tested treatments for human illnesses and injuries but mainly it was the area where they surgically attached the mind controlling devices. This act seemed to be carried out at very young childhood ages. Looking at them was like looking back at myself at different stages of my past.
One room contained large blue drums of amniotic based fluids which were pumped through a complex structure of transparent tubes and separated to the pods. I noticed an area dedicated to trying to create female cloned volks. They tried to use my mothers DNA and there were other experiments too. Somehow they thought they could use human females to create female volks, but they were hideous and barely alive. This only confirmed what I had said from the beginning; 'humans are not compatible with volks.'
Even at our depth, we could still hear the military voices over the intercoms. ...Sir, contact has been re-established with the Knolix project... It seems the Eddy factor lives and has taken control of the Island. Our agents and military personnel have been cut down to half and the level one cloning factors, set free... Knolix project is situation critical... We require instructions and await your order...
We must confer with our higher sources... Please stand by for orders... The message broke off to static. Likely we were not the only ones to hear the intercom. Below, Grizz and I watched as agents ran around in a panic to keep the vault under control. Young soldier clones were also active below so Grizz and I had to take extreme measures to keep from being discovered. I knew how snappy and dangerous a small volk boy had the potential of being.
To our left, at the end of the metal terrace, was a lit unoccupied room. The door had been left wide open. Grizz and I cautiously crawled along the terrace to the empty room. I quickly scanned the room. Blue prints and charts decorated the walls all around except for one wall made of glass for people to overlook the top secret cloning project below. We moved into the room between the maze of desks, always careful to keep hidden from anyone noticing us through the large window.
The desks, counters and shelves were cluttered with half assembled small motors along with tools and compact micro-chip circuit boards. The room seemed very unorganized consisting of only two computers. 
I was surprised to find the two computers were the super computers which were the communicational brains behind the decisions made by the countless clone volks.
I recognized one of the head mounted, mind manipulating devices like the ones each of the clones had attached and partially embedded into its head. A quick study of the charts revealed how the mind control devices used two different types of ultra sound impulses which were used to relax the cerebellum and put it into a sort of dream state. The devices were attached to the right temple and base of the clones skull. These devices were activated after drilling the skulls, inserting the device, making necessary connections with the brain before anchoring the device into place at the skull with four small screws. The whole process of sending and receiving messages was controlled through the mind control device in conjunction with a nero-drug stimuli. The stimuli was painlessly injected into the brain at controlled dosages.
The mind control device was tapped into the sensory area, auditory area, parietal lobe and the occipital lobe. From these areas of the brain, scientists could send pictures to the clones minds eye. They could play upon the clones anger and at the same time present pictures of Grizz and myself to the Clones mind. The clones would feel a great need to find and kill us to satisfy their aggressiveness.
I had a theory, the clones lacked the experience of simple everyday living to carry out their mission effectively. They would act like robots rather than true volk soldiers. I was certain this gave me an edge. Keeping low, I moved to the computer and quietly booted it up.
Grizz found a large mechanical device on a table top and decided to pick it up for a closer look. He could not figure out what purpose the device could serve. As he slid it over the table, he coincidentally began to drag another heavier object along with it by a long electrical cord. The other object looked like a piece of expensive computer hardware. Grizz slowly pulled the device to himself from the table.
I turned and noticed the computer hardware hanging half off the desk. Grizz. I tried to warn him in a whisper. Grizz was startled and snapped his head around to look at me. The hardware fell from the desk and smashed to the floor loudly. Grizz jolted with surprise and dropped the strange device from his hands and it also clattered to the floor.
I turned the computer off and grabbed my ax. Quick, Hide! Hide! I whispered urgently. We backed up and stood at either sides of the door. Sure enough, a cloned soldier approached the open door. It couldn't have been more than ten years old as he popped his head into the room. I surprised the young clone soldier as I swung my axe at him. The cloned soldier was too fast and ducked back out of the door before I inflicted any injury. As I brought my axe back up, the clone came back into the room fearlessly and aimed its powerful rifle at me. Grizz grabbed the clone from behind as a shot was fired. I felt the impact of the bullet hit me in the chest and I was thrown backwards against the wall. Grizz grabbed the clone by the mind control device and pulled it loose from its skull. The clone fell to the ground and began to convulse. Thick dark red blood oozed from the wound of its head.

I opened my eyes as Grizz shook me to stand up. Ive been shot! I imagined the damage caused from the clones rifle and how the rocket bullet must have blown away the whole half of my body.
He must have missed. Now lets go! Grizz reported.
'What did he say? How could I not have been shot? The rifle was pointing at me when it fired.' I looked down at myself and to my surprise, I was okay. I bent my body forward pushing away from the floor with my elbows. My axe laid beside me with a streak of burnt black ammunition residue gouged into the side of the blade. Apparently, the blast glanced off my blade and I was spared.
Grizz helped me up and we were about to leave when I discovered an opportunity. Grizz, help me get this clone out of his uniform. As we undressed the clone, I found its head was turned impossibly to one side. Grizz no doubt broke its neck to stop its convulsions.
I was more than happy to take off the sweat soaked cover alls which I had been wearing from the mechanic's shop. I fully dressed into the clone soldiers uniform, and it was a very tight fit. Likewise, the dead clone was dressed in my old attire. When I removed the top of the clones uniform, I noticed it also had a tattoo on the bicep of its right arm which was the very same planet and eagle as mine with the same words Property of the U.S.A. I strapped one of the mind control devices to my head. It did not attach properly and wobbled as it hung loosely. I awoke within the cock-pit of the life boat insectular unit, but something was wrong. I was all alone. 'Grizz was beside me when I fell asleep. Where could he be, now?' I wondered.
The Zandith Crockmior L/X life boat was wounded. I tried to use the organic sensor equipment, but when I no longer had any response from the life boat, I realized it was dead. A major artificial blood vessel, had ruptured as a result from the bullet wound to the abdomen. It internally bled to death, But how is it I too am not dead? I wondered.
I cleared my throat and took in a breath. The air seemed somehow fake, but filtered. Evon. I called out loudly with a deep raspy voice.
My sertz came out of my ear when I summoned it. WHAT IS IT, MY LORD? Evon flew to a position facing me where it hovered at eye level.
Where is Grizz? I asked my sertz urgently.
GRIZZS IMPATIENT CURIOUSITY LED HIM TO LEAVE IN FRUSTRATION. HE COULD NOT WAKE YOU UP EVEN AFTER HIS MANY VIOLENT ATTEMPTS. HE SEEMED TO HAVE SOME SORT OF STRUGGLE OUTSIDE THE ZANDITH CROCKMIOR BUT NOW HE IS GONE. 
Gone? I questioned like I couldnt hear the sertz the first time.
HE IS NO LONGER IN THIS CHAMBER WITH US, MASTER. HE IS SOMEWHERE ELSE IN THIS STATION. Evon explained with its usual loyal mannerism.
So, that was why my jaw felt sore and stiff. Grizz struck me trying to wake me up. I realized, rubbing my jaw.
I had to find Grizz. I slid through the throat of the insectular unit. I struggled to the inner mouth, pushing my way past the dead flesh. When the insectular unit was fully functional, it could use the muscles of the throat to help the occupant in or out. My slow crawl became increasingly claustrophobic. Finally, I pushed open the mandibles and floated out. Low gravity beckoned me outside the insectular unit. Upon taking a deep breath, the air was strange, as though manufactured. I looked at the long lanky limbs of the insectular vehicle and noticed Grizzs armor was missing. Recovering my double bladed axe, I figured where ever he was he must be clad in his heavy gear.
I floated out and examined my surroundings. I was in the very same chamber of the strange alien space station which Grizz must have navigated the life boat unit into. Many large robotic arms were folded up and stationed all around the Zandith Crockmior, mounted to the walls. Two of these great arms were holding the Zandith Crockmior. Between the robotic arms were tall crystal cylinders. Where there were vertical crystals, I could see the metal of the walls and lining supports. The walls of the inner loading bay were made of the shiniest silver I ever saw. I floated closer to the walls and examined them further. I was surprised to find the strange metal was flowing with built in conduits of iridescent energy. Clusters of tiny lights flashed across the surface of the walls. Telepathically, I learned the lights were the same living lights which penetrated the hull of the Zandith Crockmior earlier. They sometimes left the surface all together and shot through the air. 
Not sure of who, what or where the telepathic information was coming from, I put my ear close to the wall. The telepathy was unobtrusive like a whisper. Focusing to hear the thoughts through the sounds of the lights or any other noise, but these things were silent, still my mind was detecting something. I listened for a slight vibration being carried through the hull as I pulled my ear away. I touched the wall with my finger. I found no reaction to the structure of the wall. Satisfied I would not be burned, I placed the palm of my hand against the wall. I found no vibrations, but the wall was warm. Occasionally, the strange little lights would flash to my skin only to flash away just as instantly as they arrived. Most of the lights seemed to be interested with my hand, but they moved so fast and randomly I ruled out any sort of intelligence.
As I moved along the wall, I came to a series of several tall crystal cylinders. These crystals were in various levels of the cargo hold in repeated sections up to five stories high. I floated to the crystals and tried to open them because of a whispered instruction which I had received telepathically. The crystals did not want to open for me, but I knew there was something to be found on the other side and I knew it would be intelligent, whatever it was.
I worked my powerful volk fingers between the center of the crystal cylinders. Flexing and forcing my powerful volk strength with the drive of a diesel engine, I spread the crystal cylinders apart like a curtain.
What I saw on the other side was like a giant tunnel section of a short stretch of road way. At each end of the road was a swirling portal of energy. Giant alien creatures were materializing out from one swirl at high speed and running or flying through to the other swirl where they darted in and dematerialized. The short stretch of road was like a two lane highway and the creatures who used it were not easy to see because they were traveling through so quickly.
Things are always getting weirder and weirder as I go. I said to myself. I must be dreaming. slapping myself in the face with the hopes of waking up from a strange dream, I became aware that the fast moving Morguldeans had quickly slowed to a stop and turned their great eyes to look at me.
The Morguldeans were hideously strange to me and they had bone plated skin with many spikes at random like the armored hide of a crab. Their legs were insect-like and thin. Their single eye cluster was at the end of their long retractable neck. Where the Morguldeans stomach was expected to be it had a great vertical mouth. At the back of the Morguldeans was a thick appendage which connected the creature to a great shell where they housed vital organs and a great brain. The shells were each very different. Some were smooth while others were spiky and rough with a variety of colors. At the bottom of the great shells were six spider-like legs. No two Morguldeans looked the same, though it was not easy to tell them apart. 
The high speed activity quickly slowed to a stop as the portals also stopped swirling and came to a halt like the stillness and depth of space. No one came through the portals from that point and each of the creatures raised their eyes telescopically and fixed on me.
I stopped slapping myself realizing I could not wake up because I wasn't sleeping and opened my dark eyes wide at the giant Morguldeans as they ominously and threateningly moved toward me. I turned to duck back into the cargo hold but a powerful telekinetic force seized my body. The telekinesis seemed to be the invisible extension of the Morguldeans clawed hand which held me too tightly at my waist. With my hands on the crystal cylinders, I challenged the strength of the Morguldean. Pulling myself into the chamber slightly, I was able to grab hold of the handle of my axe before I was over powered by the Morguldean.
Yanked by my waste, I was tossed out to the crowded roadway. With a controlled tuck and roll landing, I sprang to my feet and brandished my axe in a defensive pose. While fully prepared to protect myself against the ugly creatures, telepathic communication began to ease into my mind, We are Morguldeans. We are superior to you but we do not wish to hurt you. Relinquish your weapon and come with us peacefully and we will take you to your companion.
I spoke in response to the Morguldeans with the same method of telepathy, Your terms are not the same as my own. How about, I keep the weapon and you go find my companion for me. Dont try intimidating me. I dont care how big you are or how smart you think you are. I have come too close to my goal to have the likes of you stand in my way now. With a swagger of confidence and attitude, I could see how my thoughts caused the Morguldeans to consider rethinking their calculations for a moment.
Without hesitation, the Morguldeans moved to attack me, but with equal speed and precision, I swung my axe into action and began lopping limbs off the Morguldeans as they advanced on me. The dismembered large arms and spider legs caused the creatures to reel in pain and clumsily they retreated from me to a distance out of reach.
I eyed the creatures like a fine tuned weapon of expert skill. The wounded Morguldeans collected their severed body parts and began putting them back in place like they would heal up instantly. Even their thick yellowish blood slowly bled back into the wounds. Other Morguldeans held small devises which were used to shine a light on the wounds of the wounded and finalize the healing process. All of the Morguldeans reorganized themselves and held new positions brandishing weapons pulled from their shells. The weapons were constructed, each with its own variance, but basically they were long golden rods with smaller metal rods twisted in and around them. With the sound of multiple slow raised chirps, the energy weapons of the Morguldeans charged up. Disks formed under the spider legs as some of the Morguldeans rose off the street and traveled over head in the high tunnel. 
That stung, volk. They knew of my species. We can re-attach our severed limbs and heal any wound. It is time we return the favor, and for your sake you better be able to do the same. The Morguldeans blinked with their singular eye lids, never letting me out of their sight.
You want a piece of me? I taunted the Morguldeans with my mind, Come over here and take it. I finished by speaking standard words. In no time, the Morguldeans fought like they were as good as new. I began to shout as I ran at the Morguldeans. 
I planned to slide under the Morguldean nearest me as I raised my axe blade enough to score a long laceration and let the internals from the shell hang out from the opening. 
Instead, as I charged at the Morguldean I was suddenly seized and captured with both telepathy and telekinesis. Evon, can you protect me from the mental powers of these creatures? through clenched teeth, I questioned my sertz.
The small robot came shooting out of my ear and answered, I AM ABLE TO BLOCK THE ABILITIES OF THESE CREATURES, MY LORD.
Block them! Block them! I commanded before I dropped from mid-air. Both, the telepathy and telekinesis vanished from any hold it had over me.
Evon, the sertz continued to fly near me as it resonated a hypersonic frequency which disabled some of the Morguldean's abilities.
Using the slope and spikes of the Morguldean's shell, I climbed up to the top of the wounded Morguldean. As I leaped from the shell, one of the hotshot Morguldeans tried to shoot at me, but his weapon missed and only further injured the wounded Morguldean.
From a spinning bound in low G, I elbowed one of the Morguldeans right in its great eye. As I used the leverage from my lightning quick attack, I saw how the eye was a definite weak spot. The entire creature instantly recoiled into its shell with a terrible shriek. Knowing where to strike the creatures to cause them the most pain, I quickly round housed the next Morguldean in its eye as I shouted, Evon! Target their eyes.
The little robotic sertz flew out of my ear and began shooting tiny colorful stars, hitting multiple Morguldeans in their eyes. The Morguldeans quickly recoiled into their shells so quickly and with such force the shells spun around in the low gravity.
Though I was a very large volk and my huge muscles were unproportional
 to that of human, I was still capable of maneuvers conducted with incredible speed and strength. One after the other, I began striking the Morguldeans eyes rapidly. With each eye that was struck, the Morguldeans would retract instantly into their shells. The Morguldeans quickly realized my plan for a skillful and tactical attack on their eyes and began protecting themselves. Most of them retracted the long necks of their eyes into their bodies as far as they could so they were still able to see. 
When I leaped through the air again, I landed on the road with a tuck and roll before slipping unnoticed into the crowd and hiding underneath one of the Morguldeans. Blocking the telepathic attempts of getting inside my mind, the Morguldeans became very agitated. The huge dark portals were active again as they started swirling. As a precaution, many of them backed into the portals at each end of the two lane street. As seconds ticked by, the Morguldeans grew more anxious and paranoid. 
Climbing up the back of one of the Morguldean's shells, I straddled it holding on tightly to its spikes. An energy field formed around the entire creature as it lifted off the floor and began to fly. I rode it like a flying turtle. Lurching forward, I became a stowaway along for the ride to where ever as the Morguldean ventured right into one of the rolling black portals.

Instantaneously, I found myself popping out of the other end of the portal where I found myself amongst an entirely different place. I had been transported near the top of the inside of the space stations dome. Far below me was the encased planet of the Morguldeans. Oh, great, now Im really lost. I thought as I took in the magnificent sight of Morguldean civilization far below me. Though I didnt want to remain at such a dangerous altitude above the cities, I wasnt particularly thrilled about descending closer to one of them.
The Morguldean dived down toward the encased planet's surface. We passed by floating mechanical stations and through clouds before a mysterious telepathic message came to my mind. Follow my voice and you will find me. spoke the friendly thought to my mind, only I found this thought was not intrusive as the other Morguldeans had been. This thought was not the same at all. I could relate to the mind behind the thought like it was somehow relative to my own. For a moment I considered the thought came from Grizz, but Grizz was always far too aggressive to be so calm and subtle. 
The Morguldean's telescopic cluster eye extended over its back and gazed at me. I was aware that the Morguldean had received the same telepathic message and it decided to follow the same voice which spoke to my mind. The Morguldean and I found we were lured to a specific city and building of the Morguldean world and then to a specific window as well.
The whole incident began to bother me as I suspected if this was a method of misleading trickery which had captured Grizz.

While I was still observing from behind the window, I saw the human-like form was so small next to the large alien counters and strange consoles. I will not harm you.

Yes, that was when you began telling me your story, When Jupacious smiled with his eyes, the wrinkles of his volk face stretched and he looked a little younger. A marvellous story, Eddy Evon, and here we are at the end of your story. You will not have to wait long, Eddy. I need you to have patience, for all is in readiness. Eddy and Jupacious did not wait long before the huge door opened and a huge Morguldeans body filled the door frame. 
At twenty-four feet tall, the Morguldean loomed over them menacingly. The presence of the Morguldeans were like two bodies of superiority combined. The frontal body was layered with muscle and bone. They had thick skeletal frames with over-sized muscles and tendons. All of this was covered again with outer skeletal shell plates. These shell plates were covered also with a thick flexible but tough skin. Its structure was shaped with two legs and two arms and it had dark tones to its body. A brutal and gruesome body covered with a series of bony outer plates like a volks for-arms and shoulder plates, only darker and rougher. Standing before us on two oddly bowed legs, the Morguldean lowered its head to the volks. The head of the Morguldean was a cluster of four eyes and its mouth was at its stomach. Jupacious and Eddy were lifted onto the Morguldean's claw with the use of telekinetic power of will. Not only did the heavy steps echo throughout the long hall but the clattering sounds of the spidery legs which carried the Morguldeans huge swirling shelled caboose behind joined in with a sound of rapid tapping. It was almost like music. Jupacious opened up a conversation and I was apart of a great train of thoughts from throughout the space station. The Morguldeans were masters at the balanced use of telepathy and telekinesis. Eddy found he was apart of the world of Morguldean thought. 
Two or more minds were needed to establish telepathy. One mind through the joining of many where there is no telling the truth for there is no telling of a lie. A pure telepathic link means there is no way of deception. No secrets could be hidden. This type of open telepathy was like torture for the Ornocks. For this reason the Ornocks were not able to approach Genation.
Telepathically it was revealed to Eddy how Jupacious was planning to take him and Grizz on a trip but for the moment he needed to go a separate way in order to make preparations. Eddy wanted Jupacious to join the collective as it was revealed how Jupacious had a personal stake in the mission of Eddy and Grizz returning to Verticus of the Ied era. Jupacious was handed over to another Morguldean and the two of them phased right through a solid wall and the telepathic awareness of him went out like a light bulb. Giant Morguldeans filled the room. They were lounging on strange chairs designed for their odd alien forms. Not one of them regarded Eddy as he was carried through the diner. If only chuckles could see this. Eddy saw many Morguldean tongues lick at food which rolled out of their mouths to the floor. Some of the sounds they made while they ate were like laughing. I'm fine, Grizz.
They took me from you at your bumble bee space ship and they were beginning to rough me up. All I wanted to do was escape and survive but these aliens can be treacherous when they want to be. They doped me up with some strange light they flashed in my eyes. I let them scan me, poke me and probe me all they wanted. They were just curious about me. I told you, we should turn around and go back to earth, but... Grizz stood up on the floor of the container and turned himself from side to side at the waist, prior to stretching the muscles of his arms. Look at me, Eddy. I Feel great.

Im glad to hear it, Grizz. Now listen, while these Morguldeans were scanning you I made contact with a volk right here in this station. Things are working out for us here, and I dont want to mess with a good thing.

Well, I hope it wont have to come to that. I am glad to see youre doing fine Eddy looked up and beheld the sight of Morguldeans gathered all around them. Sure, Grizz, they are the strange ones. I heckled Grizz humorously, but Grizz decided to ignore me.

None of the Galordians were able to leave the boundaries of Genation, but Jupacious found a way for one of them to be appointed and become connected to a space craft. Ed-man, it's too big. Breathed Grizz, in awe the closer they approached it.

Eddy approached Jupacious holding out some of the food from his pocket. Jupacious gladly accepted the offer and smiled at Eddy. Something in the eyes of Jupacious caused Eddy to feel more alive. Grizz remained silent with no coy remarks.
With the increased blood flow throughout Eddys body he began to heat up and sweat. Jupacious turned away, taking a great bite from the pink flaky food as he sat down at the control panel of the guidance seat.
With a mouthful of food he said, If you will sit here beside me, Eddy, I will show you how to work these controls. He motioned for Eddy to sit beside him at another guidance station.

A large door of the cargo bay slid open and the Quasarious moved out slow and gallantly. The sleek shape of the huge space craft reflected on the side of the gigantic Morguldean space station. They moved out from the purple energy ribbon, where they set a course with precise speed and headed for the eye of the blue swirl of Genation. Like a dart to the bulls eye of a target board they flew to the center of the swirl where the great spear of light made contact with its source of light. Lightening flashed with a crackling of pure energy as the space craft powered up and delivered a deep ominous BOOM!
Eddy and Grizz vanished into Genation to another space and time.

Mulunac and Eddy floated near to a great wall of substance and mass decorated in the most magnificent designs. Jupacious took his place at his throne which was actually a glorified con-cave area built into the steep menacing wall. Eddy quickly took his place, in a slightly less magnificent, but no less spectacular, shallow open hole. The chamber itself was packed full of blue Galordians waiting patiently to hear the importance of their King.
En-wreathed around each of the con-cave thrones were intricate designs created from metals of white, silver and crystal. Sculptures of creatures, planets and other significant materials collected from the worlds of Genation were hedged within of the intricate artistry. The only creature Eddy recognized was the small statue of a Morguldean.
Both Mulunac and Eddy were able to super charge the Galordians and the Kalordians who filled the main chamber. From their specially designed thrones they could equally charge-up, and empower Galordians who occupied the palace area of Protalentus. Within Genation the specific Galordian power or Kalordian power seemed to be available with no end. Genation was teaming with many kinds of energies. Eddy found the more power he used, the more power was available to him. After Mulunac and Eddy empowered the Galordians, they themselves were empowered.
All Galordians and Kalordians of Genation, hear me, for my voice is the voice of your King, King Jupacious. Join me as we welcome Prince Avorien, heir to the throne of Genation. An escalating noise immediately filled the great chamber as the Galordians and Kalordians cheered. Onward now, to more pressing matters. I have told you all, before I ventured out on my quest, I would not return until I had found the answer which would bring harmony back to Genation and amongst you Galordians and Kalordians. The mystery to this puzzle is as good as solved here in my son and your prince, prince Avorien. My faith has been restored in the knowledge of prince Avorien's purpose which is to bring to you all, the great gift of peace and harmony. All of this is found inside of him.
A distilled silence fell upon the palace. Eddy was suddenly aware of the animosity between the Galordians and Kalordians. The words of their King, Jupacious, seemed to make reference to them living together. From Eddy's understanding, it was a bitterness which drove them apart. Like a blood feud which ran so deep with such an unforgiving and merciless history, a simple solution was not obvious. Then it was clear to Eddy, the full range and scope of the problem. He found it was a mathematical improbability for these two opposites to ever find peace. Yet, Mulunac understood, at one time peace did exist. It was in this hope of peace where King Jupacious and Prince Avorien believed they could preserve existence. The first step was to imprison Scade-O-Rukk, but this second step of peace would be an added guarantee that creation would not be on its way to self-implosion. Eddy faced the strange possibility of the end of all things and found it was a possibility which weighed heavily on the mind of Efferstauo. The eyes of Eddy Evon had finally been opened by the full scope and serious magnitude of the situation.
No wonder my father was so wound-up in his work. Eddy thought as he looked around at the monumental responsibility before him. Here, in this place, King Jupacious held the balance of existence of all in the palm of his hand.
Suddenly, through tenulobe telepathic means, Eddy had knowledge how the Galordians were trying to keep secrets from the Kalordians. Then he realized other secrets the Kalordians were trying to keep from the Galordians. The creatures and weapons which were secretly being prepared by each side for war made human defense weapons seem like baby toys.
I have much for you all to do in preparation of the day when prince Avorien will complete his destiny. The statement made by King Jupacious was followed by silence.
'My what?' Eddy questioned in his silent thought. 'Is he sure about all of this? How does my father believe he has the answers to my destiny?' Mulunac turned to Eddy and Eddy was aware how through the tenulobe stream (mind-link) all of the Galordians knew of his questions.
Prince Avorien IS the one! Boomed the voice of Jupacious. Then with a more calm and relaxed voice he added, Though he may not know it yet.
The silence became increasingly louder within the tenulobe stream. Prince Avorien may not know what his full potential will transpire to, but I know. With a powerful jolt of energy, a tremor surged throughout the planet, and an experience was shared.
An experience emanated from King Jupacious. He had opened himself up to the memory of the first time he became a part of the Galordian microverse of Genation. Eddy was fully alert. He had anticipated the moment where he would understand his father's story. What better source is there than to experience it from his own father's memory.

'For most of my childhood I felt deeply drawn to this particular nebula. Several times, it would appear in my dreams. Whenever I would see representations of the twin nebula, I would get a strange chill up my spines.' King Jupacious wore no expression over his bright face and he spoke not a word. He simply relaxed and focused on his memories.
'Shortly after I was married, I took my new bride to this Genation nebula. It was as amazing as I had always dreamed it to be. We had to push our way through a strange storm or barrier. According to my scans, this barrier was like a perimeter surrounding both monstrous nebulas within.'
'A strange cluster of lights taunted me to follow them. I now know that the strange lights were a group of Galordians. I followed them right into the purple energy ribbon. There your mother and I found our space craft, the Zandith Crockmior, entrapped within the ribbon of purple energy. We had no control and it promptly took us into the blue Genation swirl. At the center of the swirl where the great projection of light reached out, was the destination where we were being directed. At the moment we made contact with the spear of light and were swallowed up into the blue Genation swirl, we were unaware we had traveled in the reverse of time. A distance of millions of years was traveled in a frame of moment of time. All we experienced was how we were suddenly within the heart of a great turning firmament of fire. I could feel the fire which surrounded us was alive. Two great stars were like eyes glaring at us. An insatiable emotion washed over me of pure hatred for the living fire. Somehow, I knew, I needed to fight it.'
'The Galordians responded to my burning sense of fury. They entered the craft and I began to absorb them into my body. They empowered me. My eyes lit up brightly and my skin began to glow with power. My molecular density began to gain in mass just as it also absorbed so much energy I became ghost like. I passed through my clothes, then I passed right through the hull of the craft. I had a new sense of control over my body. I was paralyzed and unable to use my limbs as I once did, rather I could direct my body in flight with mere thoughts.'
'I was aware the living fire surrounding us was the keeper of the Genation realm and he was pure evil. The Galordians referred to it as Scade-O-Rukk. Just as Scade-O-Rukk was about to attack both me and the craft, the Galordians banded together in a treasonous act to assist me. They created a mass of blue energy which came at me and swept me away. Scade-O-Rukk immediately gave chase and we moved out to the perimeter of the Genation nebula. In a wide arc, I circled back. From there I saw the Genation nebula appeared much different. It was a beautiful nebula of purple inter woven gases which allowed the transferral movement of power and energies. At the center of the gaseous maelstrom were two intersecting beams of powerful light. Instinctively, I wanted to return to your mother but it was more important to protect her. I passed by near to her so I could have one final glimpse of her before she would be lost from me forever. I guided the Galordians to slam into the center of two great intersecting beams of light. The explosion was incredible. existence was very different in this place, milli-seconds were like hours to me. In an instant the Galordians made me aware of Scade-O-Rukks power and they assisted me in claiming it as my own. The powers of Scade-O-Rukk were unlocked free as Scade-O-Rukk had never fathomed the possibility of ever being robbed. The Galordians urged me to absorb the powers as we watched Scade-O-Rukk on his approach. Not only did i absorb the great powers like a thief in the night, but I secured them as well.'
'I found, from the information of the Galordians, just as once predicted long ago, a humble challenger would rise up and defeat Scade-O-Rukk. They had named this predicted challenger, King Jupacious. Thus, I not only claimed the powers of the Genation realm, I also claimed the name and title of King Jupacious. If I wanted to continue receiving co-operation from the Galordians it was clear I would also have to become their King Jupacious. Once I ruled the Galordians, the rest of Genations powers became mine.'
'Swiftly and powerfully, Scade-O-Rukk charged in at me. He had every intention of destroying me but when I gathered his own powers against him, his embodiment of fire exploded. We locked together in a sort of tug-of-war for power. The time-line staff of light was broken. I held the past while Scade-O-Rukk held the future. This was very dangerous to me, but the Galordians explained how it was not something I had to worry about. Scade-O-Rukk thought he had the upper hand until I gathered the power and knocked him back.'
'Impossible! Conceived Scade-O-Rukk, with fire blazing from his eyes. He cant do this! There is no way he could know how!'
'Scade-O-Rukk stood by and witnessed as I absorbed all of the Galordians. Then I absorbed all of Genation. I became omnipotent and continued to suck the power of the red flames from Scade-O-Rukk. I grew incomparably large as Scade-O-Rukk shrunk into a being of organic form, but throughout the struggle I was not successful in taking one power from Scade-O-Rukk, the power from his time-line staff of the future. Though I was powerful enough to do almost anything I wanted, the faithful Galordians warned me not to destroy Scade-O-Rukk or it would lead to the destruction of all things created. I wanted to destroy Scade-O-Rukk more than anything, but with great self discipline, I was able to find another way.'
'Though I was unable to destroy Scade-O-Rukk and I was unable to leave the boundaries of Genation, I imprisoned Scade-O-Rukk in a great asteroid comprised of solid dense matter. After this, I found I too was imprisoned in Genation. Scade-O-Rukk had no power to break free from the asteroid and if he ever could he would not survive. The red Galordians were faithful to Scade-O-Rukk, more so than the Blue Galordians. I named the Red Galordians; Kalordians and a rivalry grew between them and the Galordians. In the end the Kalordians remained with Scade-O-Rukk and I set a red swirl of hydrogen gas around both Scade-O-Rukk and the Kalordians. For me and the Galordians I created a swirling gas to be the exact opposite of Scade-O-Rukks. Balance existed in Genation as, one of the time-line spears of light, the future, pierced the red swirl while the other one, the past, pierced the blue. King Jupacious ended his tale with a look of concentration over his face.

All at once the Galordians cheered for their masters. Mulunac led Eddy out of the kingdom and began to take him on the long stretch back to the Quasarious, but Eddy was following not knowing the destination Mulunac had in mind.
While they were passing out of the solar system of Spextroiuz, Eddy asked, Father, why have we been chosen of the known existence to be the only ones to wield such power? What is it that makes us so special?
I cannot say for you, except that you are my son, but as you now know, before I was brought here to Genation, I was contacted by a force bigger than our unlimited space and beyond the expanse of time... Yes, it was much bigger.
God? Eddy asked with wonderment in his eyes.
Greater than anything one could experience in this world or any other. It was the creator... What makes us so special, you ask? We will likely never know, only the overseer knows the answer. All I can tell you is we have been chosen. Don't worry about the answers, son, just do the best you can to do the right thing.
Then why have I not had such an experience? Eddy was disappointed at the thought of having missed out on such an exciting encounter.
Is it not obvious? Yes, it is clear now. Youre time to do this work has not yet come. Mulunac began to lead Eddy back. Follow me, I will return you to your vessel, Quasarious. I will send you home.

Perplexed, Eddy did not know how he felt. He wanted to stay. He wanted to go. He wanted to please his father. Confused with thought, as though it was a great weight, even too heavy for his own great volk strength to endure. Until it occurred to Eddy that this was to be the end. Time was short and he was not sure if he would ever see his father again. As Mulunac began to lead his son back to the Quasarious, Eddy stopped him, Father, wait please, I have questions, still. Questions I need answered.
Then I shall answer them on the way, come Eddy, onward. Mulunac urged Eddy before they bolted away.
I dont understand how it is, you live. By all rights, you are supposed to be dead.
Mulunac is dead, my son, I am now King Jupacious. I became energy as you and I are now and I was called to Genation. I passed from death and travelled a long journey to this place. One day you will join me here as well.
But if you became energy, how is it, you possessed a body within the Morguldean space station?
Galordians live at an extraordinarily greater rate of speed and time. In secret, I gave up most of my power when I learned of your approach. When you passed through the barrier, surrounding Genation, I let go of most of my power so I would have my mortal body back again. I too was surprised to find my body had grown old and sick. I find it now in constant need of nourishment. Without a need of a body, I have forgotten how to take care of it. I was unaware how much my body suffered and became malnourished. I have not tended to the needs of my body as I once did. I have no such need, so my body became weak and thin. Now I must decide if I want to rejuvenate this body or if I wish to let it die. Before Eddy's eyes, he looked on as his father placed his hands to his stomach.
Mulunac began to fill out. His muscles seemed to inflate like balloons filling with air. Mulunac's skin tightened and grew younger. The rejuvenating process was incredible. Mulunac's body still glowed brightly with power but it was as though he hadn't age a day from the moment he had first entered Genation.
Eddy was amazed how he had his long lost father back, but there was something missing, Why couldnt you come back to get mom and me with the Quasarious? She could still be alive now.
Eddy, please believe me, I am a captive of this place just as Scade-O-Rukk is. I cannot go with you.
Well, we still have a chance. We can control time. Lets go back and get her. Eddy spoke with excitement.
Eddy, you must understand. If we took her from some other point of the past, she would not be able to assist you in your journey to get to this point.
You dont want to save mom? Eddy cut in as he looked at his father like he was the devil.
Of course I do. Mulunac was obviously saddened. I have searched the possibilities, but her death was not in vein. She had a destiny to full fill and she did so. I knew to find you at this exact location and time where you found the Morguldean Space Station. With the help of the Morguldeans I was able to build the Quasarious in preparation of your arrival. We have the power to intervene when and wherever we want but the consequences of what we do may have considerable effects in a very negative way. It is reckless to bend existence around our own selfish desires. Rather, we must keep our efforts pressing forward to the goal. Our use and capability of the powers of Genation are for a greater purpose than our own little lives. Trust me, I know, I have had a lot of experience with Genation and one thing I have learned is we must put our trust in the Overseer. I didn't want your mother to perish, but as you know, you and your brother have not perished. If your mother was supposed to be here she would not have perished. Trust in the Overseer and live your life. I have lived a million life-times among the Galordians and I know this truth well.

Eddy followed his father. They traveled a direct route back to the Quasarious. Passing through the glowing golden hull to the center of the large chamber of chairs, Eddy re-took his position, sitting in the captain's chair. He placed his hands back onto the orbs at the ends of the armrests. Eddy witnessed his father explain how his power was capable of glowing brightly to project a path through time.
Changing course, Eddy piloted the Quasarious back out of the blue center of Genation and headed out on a new course to the red center. Mulunac was not able to help his son through his new course to the red Genation swirl and vanished completely from the Quasarious. Eddys body also shone intensely as his power enveloped the entire Quasarious through the future time-line. 
Eddy relied on his sertz, Evon to provide details for the exact journey which was made on Gastonish's original journey as a reference to return home. As Eddy directed the Quasarious, he realized how there was an art to the time traveling procedure. 
Finally, the Quasarious was piloted out of Genation by Eddy and with the assistance of his sertz, they returned to the year 26,864,789 AD of the Ied era.

About The Author

Robert A. Hunt resides in his home land of Canada, British Columbia. A diehard story teller since for as long as he can remember. In between building and studying, Robert finds time to write science fiction fantasy which he contends may not be so fiction and unattainable after all. We still have so much to learn about the world we live in. Robert, a full time author, has no plans of slowing down. When Robert is not writing, he is spending time with his family or exploring the beauty of North America because, for him, it is a great way to let his mind free. 

Genation: Earth Volk kicks off the Genation series; a world of complexity and excitement with other titles as, Grizz Rise of the Blackguard (Available now) which is the back story of Grizz, who is an essential character of the Genation series; Verticus, Insectivolk wars and Ultimate Power (All available soon). Other titles from Robert A. Hunt include; Jasper, The legend trilogy; The Crater Mountain Sasquatch Legend, The Coalmont Legend  are available now and The Cross Breed Legend  will be out in 2013.
